0.title: 7 cases of Omicron subvariants BA.4 & BA.5 reported in Maharashtra
0.article_body: Maharashtra Health Department has confirmed the state's first few cases of the BA.4 and BA.5 subvariants of the Omicron COVID-19 variant. Four BA.4 cases and three BA.5 cases have been reported from Pune, the state Health Department said on Saturday. The first few cases of the subvariants were confirmed in India earlier this month.

1.title: BMC completes restoration of Mumbai's 16 heritage milestones
1.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has completed the restoration of the 16 heritage milestones in the city. The project to restore the milestones, which are about 200 years old, was launched in 2020 by the BMC. Under the project, the milestones were restored and plaques with QR codes to access the information about them were installed.

2.title: PM Modi inaugurates world's 1st nano urea liquid plant in Gujarat
2.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated the world's first nano urea liquid plant by Indian Farmers Fertiliser Cooperative Limited (IFFCO) in Gujarat's Kalol. Developed with a ₹175-crore investment, the plant can produce 1.5 lakh 500 ml bottles of nano urea per day. The production unit aims to provide farmers the means to boost productivity and help increase their income.

3.title: India defeat Japan 2-1 in their first Super 4s match of men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey
3.article_body: India defeated Japan 2-1 in their first Super 4s match of men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey. With the win, India are currently placed on the top of the Super 4s points table. Manjeet Singh and Pawan Rajbhar scored for India in their match against Japan. India will next face Malaysia on Sunday. Malaysia are currently second on the points table.

4.title: Rainfall, thunderstorm predicted in several states/UTs; list released
4.article_body: Rainfall is likely over Northeast India and West Bengal and rainfall with thunderstorm over Bihar, Jharkhand and Odisha is likely over next 5 days. Rainfall is likely over Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry. Other states/ UTs which may experience rainfall include Jammu & Kashmir, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, UP and Rajasthan.

5.title: Big B's granddaughter spreads menstrual awareness with street art
5.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda on Saturday took to social media to share a picture of herself painting a mural on periods to celebrate World Menstrual Hygiene Day. She had earlier shared a video showing her team painting a wall in Mumbai's Ghatkopar East, writing, "This is our attempt to celebrate menstruation & make public places more period friendly."

6.title: 18-year-old Sriya Lenka becomes India's first K-pop star, joins Blackswan
6.article_body: An 18-year-old girl from Odisha has joined the K-pop girl group Blackswan, becoming India's first star in the Korean popular music genre, reports said. Sriya Lenka was among four people who underwent training after reportedly being chosen out of 4,000 people who had auditioned to join the group. Gabriela Strassburger Dalcin aka Gabi will also join Blackswan with Lenka.

7.title: Zilingo's PR Head resigns days after Bose fired as CEO, says 'I risk facing threats'
7.article_body: Singapore startup Zilingo's Head of PR and Communications, Naushaba Salahuddin, has resigned days after Ankiti Bose was fired as CEO for alleged financial irregularities. Salahuddin said individuals who now control Zilingo "have possibly made misleading and damaging statements" and due process has been violated. She added, "I possibly risk facing more threats and discredit for expressing dissent."

8.title: Kanye raps about custody battle with Kim in new song 'True Love'
8.article_body: Rapper Kanye West's new song 'True Love', which features late rapper XXXTentacion, is reportedly about his ongoing custody battle with ex-wife Kim Kardashian. The lyrics of the first verse are, "Wait, when you see the kids? I'll see y'all tomorrow. Wait, when the sunset? I see y'all tomorrow. Wait, when I pick 'em up? I feel like they borrowed."

9.title: Part of ceiling collapses at Pune Fire Brigade's control room
9.article_body: A part of the ceiling of the Pune Fire Brigade's control room collapsed on Friday evening. Telephone gadgets and equipment present in the room were reportedly damaged as the rubble fell on them. However, no casualties were reported in the incident. Chief Fire Officer Sunil Gilbile said that they have informed the Pune Municipal Corporation's ward office about the incident.

10.title: United Spirits to sell 32 brands, including Haywards, to Inbrew for ₹820 cr
10.article_body: United Spirits on Saturday announced that its board has approved the sale of 32 brands to Singapore-headquartered Inbrew Beverages for ₹820 crore. The transaction includes brands such as Haywards, Old Tavern, White-Mischief, Honey Bee, Green Label and Romanov. Further, United Spirits and Inbrew have entered into a five-year franchise arrangement for 11 other brands, including Bagpiper, it said.

11.title: G7 nations can lead the way on ending coal use: Germany
11.article_body: Germany has said that G7 countries can lead the way on ending the use of coal. Notably, Britain, France and Italy have set deadlines to end the use of coal in the next few years, while Germany and Canada are aiming to end its use by 2030. The US aims to end fossil fuel use for electricity generation by 2035.

12.title: Terrified to live alone after murder near my building: Devoleena
12.article_body: Television actress Devoleena Bhattacharjee has said that she is "terrified" to be living alone following a "horrific incident" near her building. The actress revealed that a man from a neighbouring building's housekeeping team killed a domestic worker and dumped the body on railway tracks. "Staying at home alone with my pet has suddenly become a bit scary," Devoleena added.

13.title: 'Boogie Woogie' was initially rejected, called downmarket: Jaaved
13.article_body: Jaaved Jaaferi has revealed that the 'Boogie Woogie' pilot was called "downmarket" and initially rejected by Sony TV executives. "Those new recruits in corporate companies, the young kids who hold significant positions [rejected it]," Jaaved added. He further said that then-head of Sony TV Sudesh Iyer bumped into Jaaved's co-judges Naved Jaaferi and Ravi Behl and told them it's "superhit".

14.title: Sameer Wankhede wanted to somehow implicate Aryan in drugs case: NCB inquiry
14.article_body: The Mumbai drugs-on-cruise case investigating officer Sameer Wankhede "was motivated to somehow implicate Aryan Khan", an SIT of the Narcotics Control Bureau has reportedly said. He "started looking at WhatsApp chats of Aryan without even formally seizing his mobile phone", the SIT said. NCB has dropped all charges against Aryan and five others in the case.

15.title: Haryana man barges into retired I-T Commissioner's home, stabs him
15.article_body: A 77-year-old retired Income Tax (I-T) Commissioner was stabbed thrice on his neck by an unidentified person, who had barged into the former's house in Haryana's Panchkula. The victim is now admitted to the ICU of a private hospital. The accused, who had covered his face with a handkerchief, was spotted on CCTV cameras installed in the locality.

16.title: They had a slightly better season: Manjrekar on RCB in IPL 2022
16.article_body: Reflecting on RCB's IPL 2022 campaign, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said RCB had a slightly better season, adding some good things have happened for them. "But more is expected of them. Having come this far, they should have won," he added. RCB failed to qualify for the final after losing to RR in Qualifier 2 on Friday.

17.title: 3 sisters, their 2 kids found dead in Raj well; family alleges dowry death
17.article_body: Bodies of three sisters, two of whom were pregnant, and their two children were found inside a well in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Saturday. According to the deceased's family members, the three women were married to three brothers from one family. The women's father claimed they were murdered by their in-laws over dowry. Police have booked the women's husbands and in-laws.

18.title: Siraj didn't have best IPL but he will come back stronger: Hesson
18.article_body: Calling Mohammed Siraj a fine bowler, RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said the pacer didn't have his best IPL season but he'll come back stronger. "[Siraj] just didn't get us those new-ball wickets, didn't get the ball swinging and probably lost a bit of confidence," he added. Siraj ended IPL 2022 season with nine wickets from 15 matches.

19.title: Chris Lynn's six lands in garden of a house in UK, CCTV footage goes viral
19.article_body: Northamptonshire opener Chris Lynn smashed a six against Durham in T20 Blast 2022 which went on to land in the garden of a house in Northampton. A CCTV footage showing the ball in garden has gone viral. The 32-year-old batter scored 83 runs off 46 deliveries, including four fours and eight sixes, as Northamptonshire won the match by 31 runs.

20.title: Kartik Aaryan eats at roadside stall at 2 am amid Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success
20.article_body: Amid Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success, Kartik Aaryan was seen eating at a roadside joint on his way back from promoting the film. In a video, when asked about having a simple meal despite his film inching towards ₹100 crore, he said, "This is ₹100 crore happiness. Everyone eats the same thing." Kartik further revealed that the time was 2 am.

21.title: The great late Shane Warne is smiling on you: RCB as RR reach IPL 2022 final
21.article_body: After RR defeated RCB in the Qualifier 2 to reach the final of IPL 2022, RCB tweeted, "The great late Shane Warne is smiling on you." RCB added, "Well played...and good luck for the final." Warne had led RR to victory in the inaugural season of IPL in 2008. RR will face GT in final of IPL 2022.

22.title: Actors should do homework, not just say lines with dialect: Sonu
22.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has stated that it is important for actors to do their homework when portraying historical characters. "[They can't] just come on sets, wear the costumes and say the lines with the dialect," the actor added. Sonu will be seen portraying the role of Chand Bardai in upcoming film 'Samrat Prithviraj' which stars Akshay Kumar and Manushi Chhillar.

23.title: My market as child star ended when I lost my first two teeth: Kamal Haasan
23.article_body: Kamal Haasan while recalling his childhood acting days, said he was "like a trained parrot" who didn't know what he was doing. "It was only when I lost my first two teeth that my market as...child star ended," he added. The actor said he feels lucky to have had worked with MGR and Shivaji (Ganesan) as a child actor.

24.title: Ship to take metal from Mariupol to Russia; Ukraine calls it 'looting'
24.article_body: A ship has entered Ukraine's Mariupol for the first time since Russia completed its capture of the port city to load metal and ship it east to Russia, Russian state-owned news agency TASS reported. The ship is set to transport some 2,700 tonnes of metal, it added. This is "looting" by Russia, Ukraine's Human Rights Ombudsman Lyudmyla Denisova said.

25.title: Youth Cong leader tries to remarry at MP mass wedding for scheme benefits, held
25.article_body: National Students' Union of India (NSUI) coordinator Netik Choudhary was arrested for trying to remarry his wife at a mass wedding event in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar to avail Mukhyamantri Kanyadan Yojana's benefits. The Youth Congress leader had reportedly married his wife 15 days ago. Choudhary was waiting at the venue when he was noticed by the organisers, who informed police.

26.title: Minister Anurag Thakur runs on treadmill at college event in Pune
26.article_body: Union Youth Affairs and Sports Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday visited Pune-based Savitribai Phule Pune University for a ceremony to name a sports complex after Indian athlete and wrestler KD Jadhav. During the visit, Thakur took part in several sports activities there. In a video, Thakur was also seen running on a treadmill for about a minute at the university.

27.title: Centre to develop framework for checking fake reviews on e-comm platforms
27.article_body: The Department of Consumer Affairs (DoCA) will develop a framework aimed at curbing fake reviews posted on e-commerce websites, the Centre announced. DoCA will develop these frameworks after studying best practices available globally, the Centre said. "E-comm players must disclose as to how they choose the most relevant reviews for display in a fair and transparent manner," DoCA Secretary said.

28.title: Shah Rukh has an 'eye for interiors', helped design production office: Gauri
28.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan said the actor has a 'keen eye for interiors' and was an important part of designing the office of their production house, Red Chillies Entertainment. "He had...huge say in design and inputs about colours and possible uses of...ceiling," Gauri added. Further, she called their Mumbai residence 'Mannat' her most memorable interior design project.

29.title: Shane Warne is looking down on us with a lot of pride: RR's Jos Buttler
29.article_body: Reacting to RR reaching an IPL final after 14 years, RR's Jos Buttler said, "Shane Warne is such an influential figure for...RR and having led the team to success in the first season, we'll miss him dearly." "We know he is looking down on us with a lot of pride today," added Buttler. Warne played 55 matches for RR.

30.title: PM Modi & his drones are both blind to people's sufferings: Cong
30.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's remark that he conducts surprise inspections of government work with the help of drones, Congress said, "PM Modi and his drones are alike." "Both [PM and drones] are blind to...people's sufferings," it added. Congress spokesperson Sunil Ahire tweeted, "PM Modi's drones only see what suits BJP's agenda. Chinese intrusion is a matter deliberately left unseen."

31.title: Govt hospital doctor held for sexually harassing nurse in UP's Bareilly
31.article_body: A doctor of a primary health centre in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing and assaulting a staff nurse. The case against the doctor, identified as Ram Krishna Verma, was lodged at the Bahedi Police station on the complaint of the staff nurse, police said. Notably, the accused allegedly hit the victim when she objected to harassment.

32.title: I'm a majnu, didn't take a thing from govt in 12 yrs: Pak PM amid ₹621cr fraud trial
32.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif on Saturday appeared in court in connection with the PKR 16 billion (around ₹621.22 crore) money laundering case lodged against him and his sons. "I have not taken anything from the government in 12.5 years...God made me the PM...I'm a 'majnu' (insane) and I did not take my legal right, my salary and benefits," said Sharif.

33.title: I'm divorced, wasn't sure if I'd be accepted by Gautam's family: Kanika
33.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, who recently tied the knot with businessman Gautam Hathiramani, has said she was surprised when Gautam proposed to her. "I wasn't sure whether we would ever get married," she said, adding, "The fact that I'm divorced with three children, I wasn't sure whether I would be accepted by him and his family. But I was wrong."

34.title: I'd be lying if I said my kids didn't feel anxious before my wedding: Kanika
34.article_body: Kanika Kapoor, speaking about how her children reacted to her decision to marry Gautam Hathiramani, said, "I'd be lying if I said...they didn't feel anxious." "A few days before...wedding, my youngest daughter...said, 'Now we're going to give you away.' I was surprised...and told her...not just me, we all are marrying him," she added. Kanika was earlier married to Raj Chandok.

35.title: Everyone in GT have stuck to their roles, played them perfectly: Parthiv
35.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has said IPL debutants GT have reached the final in this season because every team member has stuck to their roles and played them perfectly. GT had won 10 out of 14 matches in the league stage and topped the points table. GT will face RR in the final at Narendra Modi Stadium on Sunday.

36.title: Man kills wife, 2 kids with woodcutter then dies by suicide in TN
36.article_body: A 41-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after murdering his wife and two children, aged nine and 13, using an electric woodcutter at his house in Tamil Nadu's Chennai, police said on Saturday. The man had apparently done so due to financial distress, a police official said. The incident came to light after neighbours checked the house due to suspicion.

37.title: Mohammed Siraj abused on social media after RCB fail to reach IPL 2022 final
37.article_body: RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj was abused on social media after RCB failed to reach IPL 2022 final. Siraj, who conceded 31 runs in 2 overs against RR in Qualifier 2, was targeted, with some trolls giving death threats to his family. "If you want to criticise, criticise constructively," a fan wrote. "Siraj doesn't deserve this type of hate," another wrote.

38.title: Bihar government allows exploration of India's 'largest' gold reserve
38.article_body: Bihar government has decided to allow exploration of India's "largest" gold reserve in Jamui, Additional Chief Secretary-cum-Mines Commissioner Harjot Kaur Bamhrah said. Bihar is likely to sign an MoU with a central agency or agencies for preliminary stage exploration, Bamhrah added. Around 222.88 million tonnes of gold reserve is present in Jamui, as per a Geological Survey of India survey.

39.title: I try to hold one end up, let other bowlers pick wickets: Rashid Khan
39.article_body: Gujarat Titans spinner Rashid Khan has spoken on his role in the franchise ahead of the IPL final against the Rajasthan Royals in Ahmedabad on Sunday. "Teams are playing it safe against me. So, I am trying to keep it tight and that increases the chance of picking up wickets by the bowler at the other end," Khan said.

40.title: Delhi govt did nothing: Union Min on IAS couple's transfer over Delhi stadium row
40.article_body: Speaking on the Delhi stadium row in which an IAS couple was accused of using Delhi government-run Thyagraj Stadium for walking their dog, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said, "Delhi government did nothing. Centre intervened and transferred them to distant places." "It's these athletes who win medals for our country. No one should interfere with it," he added.

41.title: Bengaluru metro services on Purple Line to be affected tonight
41.article_body: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited has said the metro services on the Purple Line will be affected from Saturday night to Sunday morning amid maintenance works. The metro services will be halted between Baiyappanahalli and MG Road stations from Saturday 9.30pm till Sunday 7am. During this period, trains on the Purple Line will only run between the MG Road-Kengeri stations.

42.title: Russian billionaire named wife as owner of his firms day before EU sanctions: Report
42.article_body: Russian billionaire businessman Andrey Melnichenko ceded ownership of two of the world's largest coal and fertilisers companies to his wife the day before he was sanctioned by the European Union, as per a report. Notably, the sanctions which included freezing his assets and banning his entry into the EU, didn’t apply to his wife or the couple's children.

43.title: Won't criticise Samson for not scoring big runs in IPL 2022: Deep Dasgupta
43.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Deep Dasgupta said he won't criticise RR captain Sanju Samson for not scoring big runs in IPL 2022, as he has made sure that opener Jos Buttler is not under pressure. "If Buttler is playing the way he [is], someone has to take the responsibility and Samson has done well in that regard this season," added Dasgupta.

44.title: 35-yr-old Dalit man chained, starved, assaulted for over a day in Rajasthan
44.article_body: A 35-year-old Dalit man was allegedly starved and kept chained in a cattle shed in Rajasthan's Bundi district for over 31 hours. The victim was assaulted for dishonouring a pledge to work as an unskilled labourer for the main accused, identified as Paramjit Singh. A case has been registered against six men including Paramjit's brother, police said.

45.title: Jodie Foster to play lead role in 'True Detective' season 4
45.article_body: Jodie Foster is set to star in the fourth season of HBO's 'True Detective' series. The actress will play the lead role of Detective Liz Danvers. According to Deadline, Foster will also executive produce the show along with Barry Jenkins and Alan Page Arriaga. Directed by Issa Lopez, the show will mark Foster's first major TV role as an adult.

46.title: Shraddha Arya gets apology from designer who stole her fittings
46.article_body: Television actress Shraddha Arya, who was robbed by her interior designer earlier this week, has received an apology note from him along with the fittings and fixtures which were stolen from her new house in Mumbai's Andheri. The actress shared a note on social media thanking her fans and journalists. She wrote, "Lesson learnt: Never leave your work site unattended."

47.title: Prasidh troubles Kohli a lot, he has trapped him many times: Kaif
47.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal in IPL 2022's Eliminator by RR's Prasidh Krishna, Mohammad Kaif said, "Kohli...played a nothing shot...The ball was going out after pitching and he flirted with it." "He was forced to do that because the ball went in front of his eyes and [Prasidh] troubles him a lot. He has trapped him many times," added Kaif.

48.title: Mumbai Traffic Police to conduct two-hour no honking drive today
48.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police will conduct a no honking drive on prominent roads in the city from 5 pm to 7 pm on Saturday. The initiative is a part of an awareness programme for motorists to curb noise pollution, an official said. The traffic police will take action against drivers or vehicle owners in case of violations, the official added.

49.title: Kiara took care of me and prayed for me when I got COVID: Varun
49.article_body: Varun Dhawan, who'll be seen alongside Kiara Advani in the film 'Jugjugg Jeeyo', revealed that the actress took care of him when he tested positive for COVID-19. "She prayed for me which was very touching. Just genuine love and care and...I think we really became close friends," he added. Varun contracted COVID-19 during the filming of 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' in 2020.

50.title: RCB's total of 157 in Eliminator vs RR wasn't good at all: Sachin
50.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar said RCB's total of 157 in IPL 2022's Eliminator against RR wasn't a good total "at all". "Along with Prasidh Krishna, Obed McCoy was the key bowler. Both kept Bangalore under pressure," added Sachin. Discussing RCB batter Virat Kohli's dismissal by Prasidh, Tendulkar stated, "Kohli was beaten by the bounce...That was a fantastic delivery."

51.title: Test match is for 5 days, it's only day 3: Karti on CBI questioning
51.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram on Saturday arrived at CBI Headquarters in Delhi for the third consecutive day and said, "A test match is for five days, this is just day three." Karti is being questioned in the bribe-for-visa case. A day earlier, Karti had written to the Lok Sabha Speaker over the alleged breach of his parliamentary privilege by CBI.

52.title: Founder of Japanese terror group 'Red Army' freed after 20 years
52.article_body: The co-founder of the Japanese Red Army terrorist group has been freed from prison after serving 20 years for masterminding the 1974 siege of the French Embassy in The Hague. Fusako Shigenobu, who was arrested in 2000, was among the world's most notorious women in the 1970s and 1980s. The Japanese Red Army had carried out several attacks worldwide.

53.title: 875 kg tomatoes, 500 kg lemons, 300 kg capsicum stolen from Gurugram market
53.article_body: Over 875 kg tomatoes, 500 kg lemons and 15 packets containing over 300 kg capsicum were allegedly stolen from a shop in Gurugram's Khandsa vegetable market, the police said. "This is the first time a theft has taken place since I have been working here. We have suffered a loss of over ₹50,000-₹55,000," a worker at the shop said.

54.title: 2 killed, child injured as speeding truck rams into parked bus in UP
54.article_body: At least two people were killed and a child was injured after a speeding truck rammed into a parked bus on the Agra-Etawah highway in Uttar Pradesh, police said. The driver of the bus had parked it after it developed a technical snag. The driver was under the bus to fix it when the truck rammed into it, police added.

55.title: Hold no grudges, want to play in Australia again: Djokovic
55.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic has said that he wants to play in Australia again despite not being allowed earlier this year due to not having a COVID-19 vaccination. "I don't know anything about...whether I'm going to be allowed to come back to Australia...I would like to go there...I don't hold any grudges," the 35-year-old Serbian tennis player said.

56.title: Police arrest 3 men after 3-yr-old girl crushed to death in B'luru
56.article_body: After a three-year-old girl was crushed to death by a water tanker in Bengaluru, police have arrested three men, including the tanker's owner. The deceased girl, Pratiksha Bhat, was playing outside her house when the tanker's driver, who was trying to reverse the vehicle, didn't notice her and knocked her down. She came under the vehicle's rear wheel and died.

57.title: Everyone wanted to give clothes to Deepika, sourcing clothes for Cannes was tough: Meera
57.article_body: Meera Chopra, speaking about her experience at Cannes Film Festival, said, "Going to the festival was actually an overwhelming feeling...I went there to promote my film 'Safed'." However, she revealed that sourcing clothes for red carpet appearances was tough. "Most of the Indian designers wanted to give clothes to Deepika Padukone, or wanted to [dress] a bigger celebrity," Meera added.

58.title: Samson has been exceptional as batter, wicketkeeper, skipper: Sangakkara
58.article_body: After RR reached IPL 2022 final with a seven-wicket win over RCB, RR Director of Cricket Operations Kumar Sangakkara said skipper Sanju Samson has been exceptional. He added that Samson has done a good job in wicket-keeping, batting and leading the side in the tournament this season. The 2008 champions RR will face debutants GT in the final on Sunday.

59.title: Twitter rejects Musk-backer Durban's resignation from board
59.article_body: Twitter will not accept Tesla CEO Elon Musk-backer Egon Durban's resignation from the board. This comes days after the platform's shareholders blocked Durban's re-election at an annual meeting. Durban failed to receive the majority votes in the re-election held earlier this week due to "voting policies of certain institutional investors regarding board service limitations", Twitter said.

60.title: China, Russia block UN statement on Myanmar crisis: Reports
60.article_body: China and Russia have blocked a UN Security Council statement expressing concern about the violence and serious humanitarian situation in Myanmar, reports said. The statement was reportedly aimed at pushing Myanmar's military leaders to take steps to resolve the crisis. On Thursday, China and Russia vetoed a US-sponsored UN resolution to impose more sanctions on North Korea over missile tests.

61.title: Policeman suspended over deaths of woman, 2 daughters in UP's Baghpat
61.article_body: A sub-inspector was suspended over the deaths of a 45-year-old woman and her two daughters who allegedly consumed poison in his presence in UP's Baghpat, police said. The woman and her daughters, aged 19 and 17, consumed poison fearing arrest. Police raided their house looking for the woman's son who had allegedly kidnapped a Dalit woman and eloped with her.

62.title: 25 passengers injured as bus overturns in Jammu and Kashmir
62.article_body: At least 25 passengers were injured after the bus they were travelling in overturned in the Battal Ballian area along the highway in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur. The injured persons were shifted to the district hospital for treatment, following which six of them were further referred to a government hospital in Jammu. The bus was on its way to Doda.

63.title: Imran Khan to make comeback, will direct a film: Reports
63.article_body: Imran Khan is all set to return to the film industry as a director, as per reports. "Direction was what Imran wanted to do. He never wanted to be an actor. He is now working on the script of his first directorial," reports quoted a source as saying. According to reports, the film will go on the floors in 2023.

64.title: Any deal with Russia isn't worth a broken penny: Ukrainian negotiator
64.article_body: Ukrainian presidential advisor and peace talks negotiator Mykhailo Podolyak on Saturday said that it is impossible to negotiate with Russia that "lies cynically and propagandistically". "Any agreement with Russia isn't worth a broken penny," Podolyak added. "Russia has proved that it is a barbarian country that threatens world security...A barbarian can only be stopped by force," he further said.

65.title: 90 fall sick in Gurugram society; water contamination suspected
65.article_body: Over 90 residents of Westend Heights in DLF Phase 5 fell sick allegedly after consuming drinking water supplied by the Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority. Moreover, a two-year-old child from the society has been hospitalised due to the suspected water contamination. Gurugram's Chief Medical Officer, Dr Virender Yadav, said, "Most of the residents are suffering from nausea and vomiting."

66.title: It breaks my heart to see Boris Becker in prison: Novak Djokovic
66.article_body: Novak Djokovic said it breaks his heart to see six-time singles' Grand Slam champion and his former coach Boris Becker in prison. He added, "Boris was always so nice to me and my family...and we had a great relationship throughout the years...and achieved great things." Becker was jailed for 2.5 years for hiding assets after bankruptcy in UK.

67.title: An army of people worked on bridal look, took a long time: Manushi on Prithviraj
67.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, while recalling the wedding sequence in her upcoming movie 'Samrat Prithviraj', said, "Though it's a short one, it took a...long time for me to get ready." "There was an army of people working on me to get me ready," Manushi said, adding, "There were countless people trying to put layers and layers of clothes and jewellery on me."

68.title: Depp is a monster: Heard's lawyer in Depp-Heard closing statement
68.article_body: Amber Heard's lawyer Ben Rottenborn called Johnny Depp a monster in his closing statement in the Depp-Heard defamation trial. He said, "Let's see the monster," before playing a video of Depp slamming cabinets in the former couple's kitchen. Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez said, "Either [Heard is] a victim of truly horrific abuse or she's a woman...willing to say absolutely anything."

69.title: People think I am Jos Buttler's wife: RR batter Rassie van der Dussen's wife Lara
69.article_body: RR batter Rassie van der Dussen's wife Lara has said that people think she is Jos Buttler's wife. "I...think it's because I've been on camera...a few times. Dhanashree and I cannot control ourselves next to the field...Jos has been getting hundreds...and maybe the excitement has got people thinking probably I'm part of him, so it's quite interesting," she added.

70.title: Getting rape, death threats: BJP spokesperson after appearing on debate on Gyanvapi
70.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Nupur Sharma has alleged that she is being "bombarded with rape, death and beheading threats" against herself and her family after her appearance on a TV debate on the Gyanvapi issue. "I've communicated the same to Delhi Police," she said. She blamed fact-checker Mohammed Zubair for the alleged threats after he tweeted a video of the debate.

71.title: Startup Co-founder makes it to 'Forbes 30 Under 30', chat with his father goes viral
71.article_body: Harish Uthayakumar, Co-founder of an edtech startup BlueLearn, shared a WhatsApp chat screenshot on Twitter when he told his father that he had made it to the 'Forbes 30 under 30' list. While his father replied with two thumbs up emojis, his chat became widely circulated online. Yuvaa CEO commented, "Peak dad behaviour," while another person wrote, "Indian dad supremacy".

72.title: 15-yr-old inspired by KGF smokes full pack of cigarettes, falls severely ill in Hyd
72.article_body: A 15-year-old boy, who was inspired by the movie KGF: Chapter 2, smoked a full pack of cigarettes and fell severely ill in Hyderabad. The boy who watched the movie thrice in two days developed a severe throat ache and cough and was rushed to the hospital for treatment. Doctors said they successfully treated the teenager, apart from counselling him.

73.title: 3 inspired by 'Fast & Furious' steal 40 luxury cars in Delhi, held
73.article_body: Three men, inspired by Hollywood series 'Fast & Furious', were arrested for stealing over 40 luxury cars from across Delhi-NCR over the past one month using high-tech gadgets, including scanners and GPS jammers. The stolen cars were then sold via expensive deals in Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The accused unlocked cars by using a software-based hacking device, police said.

74.title: Have seen both highs and lows, prepared for everything now: Fatima
74.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh, in an interview, opened up about facing failures in her career. "Thugs of Hindostan is a proper example. When the film tanked, it had hit me," Fatima said. The actress added that she has seen both the highs and lows of her career and is thus prepared for everything now. "I have become calmer," Fatima added.

75.title: Troops may withdraw from eastern region amid Russian advance: Ukraine
75.article_body: Ukraine has said that its troops could withdraw from their last pocket of resistance in Luhansk to avoid being captured by Russian forces pressing an advance in the east. There are some 10,000 Russian troops in the eastern region, the Governor of Ukraine's Luhansk region, Serhiy Gaidai, said. Ukraine has asked the West for long-range weaponry to resist Russian advance.

76.title: Rare sight: Kejriwal as Delhi Transport Commissioner travels by bus
76.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday lauded Delhi Transport Commissioner Ashish Kundra as he travelled by bus. "A rare sight to see transport commissioner...travelling by...bus to take a first-hand view from travellers on the problems being faced by them," Kejriwal said. IAS officer Kundra on Saturday posted some pictures of him travelling on a bus. "Bus journey...Saturday feel," Kundra tweeted.

77.title: I'd love to see Sehwag, Kohli or Ashwin take up umpiring: Simon Taufel
77.article_body: Ex-umpire Simon Taufel has said that he would love to see Virender Sehwag, Virat Kohli or Ravichandran Ashwin take up umpiring. "They seem to be very well on top of the laws and playing conditions of the game at the moment," he added. "You have really got to have a personality and desire to want to do it," he stated.

78.title: Russia successfully tests hypersonic missile amid war in Ukraine
78.article_body: Russia has said that it has successfully test-fired a hypersonic missile over a distance of about 1,000 kilometres. The Zircon cruise missile was fired from Barents Sea and hit a target in White Sea. Despite the war in Ukraine, Russia has continued to stage high-profile weapons tests to remind the world of its prowess in missile technology, according to Reuters.

79.title: IndiGo fined ₹5 lakh for denying boarding to specially-abled child in Ranchi
79.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has fined IndiGo ₹5 lakh for denying boarding to a specially-abled boy at the Ranchi airport earlier this month. The DGCA said that the "deficient handling" by the airline staff ended up exacerbating the situation. "A more compassionate handling would have smoothened the nerves and calmed the child," DGCA stated.

80.title: Pune ZP launches citizen feedback portal 'Majhi ZP, Majha Aadhikar'
80.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has launched a social audit and feedback portal called 'Majhi ZP, Majha Aadhikar'. "Through this programme, we are seeking both appreciation and complaints of...works done through public money," the body's CEO Ayush Prasad said. He added that through the portal, which will be available on Pune ZP's website, citizens can submit feedback with comments and photos.

81.title: 2 women hide 161 cocaine capsules in stomach, held at Delhi Airport
81.article_body: In separate incidents, two women from Uganda were arrested at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after nearly two kilograms of cocaine worth ₹28 crore was found hidden in their stomachs, customs officials said. The women had concealed the cocaine in a total of 161 capsules and swallowed them. They were taken to RML Hospital for removal of capsules.

82.title: Over 1 lakh commuters hop on Delhi's new electric buses in first 3 days
82.article_body: Around one lakh commuters travelled on Delhi's new AC electric buses in first three days after being flagged off by Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on May 24. Taking to Twitter, AAP wrote, "Arvind Kejriwal government's e-buses get bumper response from Delhiites." The Delhi government had made travel free of cost for the first three days in the new buses.

83.title: Earlier our best was coming 4th in Olympics but Neeraj changed it all: PT Usha
83.article_body: Former Indian track and field athlete PT Usha has said that Neeraj Chopra winning an Olympic gold medal in javelin throw has "changed" everything for Indian athletics. "Earlier, the best we could do was reach fourth place in the Olympics but Neeraj's feat has changed all," Usha said. She also added that she started following javelin events because of Chopra.

84.title: Trent Boult gives his RR jersey to young fan after Qualifier 2 win, RR share video
84.article_body: RR have shared a video showing Trent Boult giving his RR jersey to a young fan after their victory against RCB in the Qualifier 2 of IPL 2022 on Friday. "How can you not love Trent Boult?" RR wrote alongside the video. Boult registered figures of 4-0-28-1 against RCB. RR will face GT in IPL 2022 final on Sunday.

85.title: Attending film festival like Cannes makes one feel fortunate: Richa Chadha
85.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha, while remembering her Cannes debut, said attending a "prestigious" film festival like Cannes makes one feel fortunate. "It's a matter of pride for the entire team if their film is being shown at the...festival," Richa stated. The actress had earlier shared pictures from her visit to the film festival for her films 'Gangs of Wasseypur' and 'Masaan'.

86.title: England can save Test cricket from current downward trend: McCullum
86.article_body: England's newly-appointed red-ball coach Brendon McCullum has said that England is a nation which can save Test cricket from the ongoing "downward trend". "If you look where (Test cricket) sits, it's probably on a slightly downward trend. One nation that can really change things is England, with the tradition and the fan following (of Test cricket)," McCullum said.

87.title: Anil Agarwal meets Bill Gates, says 'his knowledge about India surprises me'
87.article_body: Vedanta Resources' billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal met the world's fourth-richest person Bill Gates during World Economic Forum 2022 in Davos. Sharing a picture with the Microsoft Co-founder, Agarwal wrote on LinkedIn, "He always surprises me with how much he knows about India and his love for Indian food!" He said the two bonded over their initial struggles as first-generation entrepreneurs.

88.title: Which 10 countries topped latest Travel & Tourism Development rankings by WEF?
88.article_body: The World Economic Forum (WEF) recently released its latest Travel and Tourism Development Index, which ranked Japan at the top. The US, Spain, France, Germany, Switzerland, Australia, the UK, Singapore and Italy were also among the top 10 countries on the index. India ranked 54th on the global index but topped the South Asia region rankings.

89.title: Viral Bihar girl who hopped to school gets artificial limb, IAS officer shares pic
89.article_body: A 10-year-old girl from Bihar, who was seen hopping to school on one leg in a viral video, got an artificial limb. An image of the girl, named Seema, from Jamui district, has been shared by IAS officer Awanish Sharan. It shows her wearing a prosthetic leg. "Power of social media," Awanish wrote in the caption.

90.title: I draw a line at rape threats: Ex-Zilingo CEO on seeking legal protection in S'pore
90.article_body: Zilingo's former CEO Ankiti Bose has obtained an Expedited Protection Order from Singapore Courts against a Twitter user after being fired from the e-commerce startup. "I fear...there are elements out there that might benefit from intimidating me...by weaponising the media and social media," Bose said. "I've tried to let it go...but I draw the line at rape threats," she added.

91.title: 2 wanted criminals shot dead in Ghaziabad in 2 separate encounters
91.article_body: Ghaziabad Police shot dead two wanted criminals in two separate encounters on Friday. The criminals, identified as Billu and Rakesh, carried a bounty of ₹1 lakh and ₹50,000 on their heads respectively, police said. The first incident took place in Indirapuram and the second in Madhuban Bapudham. Billu was wanted in a double murder case last month.

92.title: RTO to not issue new auto permits in Pune division: Report
92.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office has reportedly decided not to issue new auto-rickshaw permits in the Pune division. Pune Regional Transport Officer Ajit Shinde said that there are a large number of autos in the division and to stop this increasing number of autos this decision has been taken. There are reportedly over 82,000 auto-rickshaw permits in the Pune division currently.

93.title: Govt to develop framework to check fake reviews on online shopping websites
93.article_body: The central government on Saturday said that in order to protect consumer interest, it will develop a framework to keep a check on fake reviews posted on e-commerce websites. As per an official statement, the framework will be developed after studying the present mechanism being followed by the e-commerce websites and the best practices available globally.

94.title: 'Mr. India' an iconic film, shouldn't be remade: Satish Kaushik
94.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik has said that his 1987 film 'Mr. India', which also starred Anil Kapoor, Amrish Puri and Sridevi, shouldn't be remade or given a sequel today. He added that it's "such an iconic film with such great legacy that if it ever comes out then it can only be pulled off by Anil Kapoor and no other actor".

95.title: Bengaluru police provide green corridor for liver transportation
95.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Friday provided a green corridor for liver transportation between 12.30 pm and 12.40 pm from St John's Medical College Hospital to Apollo Hospital, BG Road. The traffic police also shared a video of the same. Earlier, the traffic police also provided a green corridor for transporting a live heart and a liver separately on May 4.

96.title: Randeep shares his first look as Veer Savarkar from latter's biopic
96.article_body: Randeep Hooda on Saturday unveiled his first look as Vinayak Damodar Savarkar from an upcoming film based on the latter's life. He shared his look on the occasion of Savarkar's 139th birth anniversary. "This is a salute to...one of the tallest unsung heroes of India's struggle for freedom," Randeep wrote. Titled 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar', it'll be directed by Mahesh Manjrekar.

97.title: Pune woman trying to buy two-wheeler on OLX cheated of ₹71,060
97.article_body: A woman from Pune was cheated of ₹71,060 by a cyber fraudster who posted an advertisement to sell a two-wheeler on OLX, police said. "The fraudster lured the complainant with an offer to sell the two-wheeler at a low price...But the woman never got the vehicle," an officer said. The victim had contacted the phone number mentioned in the advertisement.

98.title: Tried to built India Bapu, Sardar Patel dreamt of: PM on 8 yrs of NDA govt
98.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said, in past eight years, the government made honest efforts to build India as dreamt by Mahatma Gandhi and Sardar Patel. "Bapu wanted an India that would empower the poor, Dalit, victim, tribals, women," he stated. Over the years, government gave top priority to the service and welfare of poor, PM Modi added.

99.title: BMC starts construction of underpasses for animals in Aarey Colony
99.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has started building animal underpasses at Mumbai's Aarey Colony in order to avoid animal-human conflict. Currently, three underpasses are being built and 15 more will be built once the monsoon season ends, a BMC official said. Notably, the locations for the underpasses are selected based on the data collected with the help of camera traps.

100.title: Depressed over mother's death, B'luru man dumps ₹1.3 cr BMW car in river
100.article_body: A Bengaluru man, depressed over his mother's death, drove his BMW car worth ₹1.3 crore into Cauvery river. Seeing the car drowning in the river, the localities suspected it to be an accident and informed the police about it. During investigation, the man's family told police that he was depressed and drove his car into the river out of dejection.

101.title: Iran seizes 2 Greek tankers in Persian Gulf amid row over US oil grab
101.article_body: Iranian forces seized two Greek tankers on Friday in helicopter-launched raids in the Persian Gulf, officials said. This comes after Iran warned it would take "punitive action" against Athens over the confiscation of Iranian oil by the US from a tanker held off the Greek coast. Iran's Revolutionary Guards said the tankers were seized due to unspecified violations.

102.title: R Praggnanandhaa writes exam hours after finishing runner-up in chess tournament at 2 am
102.article_body: India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa appeared for his Class 11 exam at 8.45 am on Friday, hours after finishing runner-up in Chessable Masters tournament. Praggnanandhaa's final match against world number two Ding Liren ended at 2.20 am. "Last few days have been incredibly tiring...it's a first for me, writing exams and playing a tournament simultaneously," he said.

103.title: Starlink has been approved in Nigeria & Mozambique: Elon Musk
103.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to announce that Starlink has been permitted to provide its service in Nigeria and Mozambique. This comes days after Musk answered a tweet about the service launch in Africa, saying, "Yes, first countries in Africa to be announced coming soon." Starlink is currently available in over 30 countries.

104.title: Thanks but no thanks: Ola CEO on Musk's tweet about Tesla manufacturing in India
104.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal responded to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet regarding the manufacture of Tesla in India and wrote, "Thanks but no thanks". Earlier, a Twitter user asked Musk if Tesla would be manufactured in India, to which he replied, "Tesla won't put a manufacturing plant in any location where we aren't allowed first to sell & service cars."

105.title: Kohli always wants to be on the front foot no matter what: Manjrekar
105.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's dismissal in IPL 2022's Eliminator, ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted, "Front foot to a short of length bouncing ball cost him his wicket again." "Kohli wanting to be on the front foot no matter what is not helping his cause," added Manjrekar in his tweet. "Mental toughness takes you far...but technical issues cannot be ignored," stated Manjrekar.

106.title: Shouldn't be taken seriously: Gehlot on Chandna's 'free me from post' tweet
106.article_body: After Rajasthan Sports Minister Ashok Chandna requested state CM Ashok Gehlot to free him from his "dishonourable" post, the CM said, "[Chandna] might've come under some stress and commented. It should not be taken seriously." Furthermore, Chandna tweeted a day later that he and Gehlot held a "meaningful" discussion and added that the Congress family is "united" for 2023 polls.

107.title: Virat Kohli made more mistakes in IPL 2022 than in his entire career: Sehwag
107.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag has said that Virat Kohli made more mistakes in IPL 2022 than in his entire career. "This is not the Virat Kohli we know. This is someone else," he added. Kohli scored 341 runs in IPL 2022 at an average of 22.73. He got out for three golden ducks in the tournament.

108.title: 'The Conjuring' house sells for over ₹11 crore in US; pics surface
108.article_body: A US home, which apparently witnessed paranormal activities chronicled in the 2013 horror film The Conjuring, is being sold for $1.525 million (over ₹11 crore). The sellers, paranormal investigators Jenn and Cory Heinzen, had bought the home in 2019 for $439,000 and had set $1.2 million as the asking price. The buyer of the house is a 58-year-old real-estate developer.

109.title: Musk shares cartoon on freeing Twitter's blue bird from a cage, Twitter users react
109.article_body: Amid the Twitter acquisition deal being put on hold, Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a cartoon featuring a caricature resembling him freeing Twitter's iconic blue bird from a cage. Meanwhile, Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus commented, "Despite all my rage, I am still just a bird in a cage." Another Twitter user wrote, "Twitter is about to get more interesting."

110.title: 19-yr-old boy shot dead in Delhi, found lying in pool of blood: Police
110.article_body: A 19-year-old boy was shot dead in Delhi's Khajuri Khas area on Friday and was found lying in a pool of blood, police said. "On physical inspection, a bullet injury mark was found on his chest," DCP (Northeast Delhi) Sanjay Kumar Sain said. "A suspect has been zeroed in and he is being tracked...will be interrogated accordingly," he added.

111.title: Life goes on even when you try to destroy it: Klopp's message to Russia
111.article_body: Talking about the Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid being moved from Russia's Saint Petersburg to France's Stade de France, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said, "I am happy...the game is here for thousands of reasons." "[It]...is exactly the right message that Russia should get: Life goes on even when you try to destroy it."

112.title: Ola driver arrested for molesting 15-year-old girl in Mumbai
112.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 29-year-old Ola cab driver for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl and making obscene gestures at her. The accused driver has been identified as Murari Kumar Singh who lives in Goregaon. "He is originally from Bihar. We are also finding out if he has any prior cases against him," the police said.

113.title: UP girl's body found in well with limbs tied 11 days after she went missing
113.article_body: The body of a 16-year-old girl, who went missing 11 days ago, was found in a sack in a well with her hands and legs tied in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, police said. "It seems...someone who knew the girl killed her...threw her body...20 kilometres from her house," police added. This comes after locals detected a foul smell coming from the well.

114.title: Not even Djokovic, Nadal slide as well as Iga Świątek on clay: McEnroe
114.article_body: Ex-world number one tennis player John McEnroe said he has never seen anyone as smooth as world number one Iga Świątek while playing on clay courts. "She's an incredible athlete. I don't think I've ever seen a player and this includes Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic...move, slide into their backhand, that far open stance two-hander and the forehand," added McEnroe.

115.title: Rachakonda Police detains 2 inter-state drug peddlers under PD Act
115.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Friday invoked the Preventive Detention (PD) Act against two inter-state drug peddlers. The accused were involved in procuring drugs at cheap rates from Andhra Pradesh and supplying them to Kerala, Maharashtra, Telangana and Karnataka, police said. The two accused, along with eight others, were arrested in December last year while selling ganja in Hyderabad, police said.

116.title: Who'll be held responsible for trauma Aryan Khan suffered?: NCP leader
116.article_body: After NCB gave Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan a clean chit in cruise drugs case, NCP leader Clyde Crasto tweeted, "Who'll be held responsible for...trauma this young man (Aryan) suffered?" "Many questions arise," he added. Furthermore, NCP chief spokesperson Mahesh Tapase claimed that NCB's decision proved that Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik was right when he called the case fake.

117.title: Communal parties like BJP bigger threat than dynastic politics: HD Kumaraswamy
117.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy criticised PM Narendra Modi's 'Pariwarwaadi politics' remark and said that communal politics is a bigger threat to India as compared to dynastic politics. "The danger to nation is not from dynastic parties, it is posed by communal parties like BJP. Parties raising emotive issues to grab political ground are a real threat to democracy," Kumaraswamy said.

118.title: Party will win at least 25 seats in Bengal in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: BJP
118.article_body: BJP MP Locket Chatterjee said that BJP will win at least 25 parliamentary seats in West Bengal in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, asserting that the party's support base among the masses is still intact. Criticising those who left BJP in Bengal and joined other parties, Chatterjee said, "Those who are leaving the party are opportunists."

119.title: 2 mountaineers killed, 9 injured in Swiss Alps ice fall
119.article_body: A 40-year-old French woman and a 65-year-old Spanish man were killed and nine other mountaineers were injured by falling blocks of ice in the Alps in southern Switzerland on Friday, police said. Seventeen climbers were in the area when the ice blocks broke off at an altitude of 3,400 metres. Seven rescue helicopters were dispatched to evacuate the climbers.

120.title: Which bowlers have been hit for most sixes in an IPL season?
120.article_body: RCB fast bowler Mohammed Siraj has set the record for conceding the most number of sixes in a season of IPL. Siraj has been hit for 31 sixes in IPL 2022. He is followed by his teammate Wanindu Hasaranga, who conceded 30 sixes in IPL 2022. CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo was slammed for 29 sixes in IPL 2018.

121.title: My personal photos, chats are being shared without consent: Ex-Zilingo CEO
121.article_body: Former Zilingo CEO Ankiti Bose on Friday shared an Instagram post about how her private data is being circulated online after she was fired from Zilingo. Ankiti wrote, "My personal photos, chats, documents, records may have...been improperly accessed and circulated without my consent...I've seen versions of them on the internet which are clearly fake…My apps are full of hate messages."

122.title: Switzerland to destroy over 6.2 lakh expired COVID vaccine doses
122.article_body: Switzerland will destroy over 6.2 lakh expired doses of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine, officials said. "It was consciously accepted that under certain circumstances too much vaccine was procured for Switzerland's needs," a Federal Office of Public Health spokesperson said. Nearly 70% of  Switzerland's population is fully vaccinated against the virus, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker.

123.title: Israeli detective used Indian hackers for Russian oligarchs' jobs: Report
123.article_body: Israeli private investigator Aviram Azari, currently in US custody, used Indian hackers to conduct surveillance operations for Russian oligarchs, court filings showed. Independent journalist Scott Stedman told a US court that Azari worked "on surveillance and cyber-intelligence operations" for the oligarchs. Russia's Oleg Deripaska reportedly employed Azari for a business dispute in Austria.

124.title: Porn movies played on screens at airport in Brazil after apparent hack
124.article_body: Porn movies were played on screens at an airport in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro after an apparent hack. Brazil's airport operator, Infraero, said the monitors were advertising screens run by a private company, not official information displays. "Infraero has taken appropriate legal action and filed a case with the federal police," it said in a statement.

125.title: Anonymous donor gives ₹1.3 crore to cover funeral costs of US school shooting victims
125.article_body: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has said an anonymous donor paid $175,000 (over ₹1.3 crore) for the funerals of the 21 victims of the mass shooting at an elementary school. "No family who is suffering from incalculable heartbreak at this time will have to worry about a single cost with regard to anything concerning this travesty," Abbott said.

126.title: Indian oil firms' dividend worth $125.5 mn stuck in Russia due to sanctions
126.article_body: A dividend amounting to $125.49 million belonging to Indian oil companies is stuck in Russia due to Western sanctions over the Ukraine war, said an Oil India official. A consortium comprising Oil India, Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation own 23.9% of Russia's Vankorneft oil project and 29.9% of the Tass-Yuryakh oilfield in east Siberia.

127.title: Rachakonda Police arrest 22-yr-old youth for harassing man, his fiancee
127.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 22-year-old youth for harassing a man and his fiancee on social media. According to police, the accused, identified as J Siddu, wanted to marry the victim's fiancee. In order to call off the marriage, Siddu created fake social media profiles and posted the victim's phone number with derogatory and vulgar messages, police added.

128.title: Over 15,000 nurses of Maha govt hospitals go on indefinite strike from today
128.article_body: Over 15,000 nurses of state-run hospitals have decided to go on indefinite strike from Saturday, Maharashtra State Nurses Association (MSNA) said. They are protesting against the state government's decision to outsource the recruitment of nurses to a private agency. "If the recruitment of nurses is outsourced, they will be vulnerable to exploitation and receive lower remuneration," MSNA added.

129.title: Priyanka shares pic of grandmother reading article about her, says 'Miss you'
129.article_body: Priyanka Chopra took to her Instagram Stories on Saturday to remember her late grandmother on her birth anniversary. She shared an old picture showing her grandmother reading a newspaper that contained an article about the actress. "Happy birthday nani. Miss you always," Priyanka wrote with a heart emoji. Priyanka's maternal grandmother, Madhu Jyotsna Akhouri, passed away in June 2016.

130.title: Sadio Mane to Bayern rumours? I couldn’t care less: Liverpool's Klopp
130.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he couldn't care less about rumours regarding a potential transfer for forward Sadio Mane to Bayern Munich. "It's not the first time that I have had a Bayern rumour come up just before a big match," added Klopp. Liverpool will take on Real Madrid in the Champions League final on May 29, 12:30 am IST.

131.title: Humour has come out better than original: RJ Balaji on Badhaai Ho remake
131.article_body: RJ Balaji, who has co-written and co-directed 'Veetla Vishesham', spoke about the upcoming film, which is the Tamil remake of Ayushmann Khurrana-starrer 'Badhaai Ho'. "We've India's two best actors Sathyaraj sir and Urvashi ma'am playing father and mother," he said, adding, "When these two came on board, it became a...different flavoured film, the humour has come out even better than...original."

132.title: 2 dead after minibus falls into Tawi river in Jammu
132.article_body: Two people were killed after a minibus fell into the Tawi river while crossing the river bridge near Bikram Chowk in Jammu. According to the police, the bus driver lost control of the vehicle and smashed the concrete fence of the bridge before the vehicle fell into the river. Notably, the deceased are yet to be identified, police said.

133.title: 149 butterfly species spotted in gardens across Pune: PMC
133.article_body: According to Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), 149 butterfly species have been spotted in gardens across the city. An environmentalist said that "a good diversity of butterflies indicates a very good diversity in the...vegetation" as each species depends on specific larval host plants. The Common Jay and Common Map species, which are usually found in jungles, were also spotted, officials said.

134.title: 2 minor sisters drown in village pond in Chhattisgarh's Surguja
134.article_body: Two minor sisters drowned in a village pond in Chhattisgarh's Surguja district, police said. The girls, aged 7 and 8, had reportedly gone to attend a wedding along with their family members on May 26. However, a search was launched after the girls didn't return home, police said, adding that their bodies were found floating in the pond on Friday.

135.title: Buttler breaks Kohli's record for hitting most boundaries in a season in IPL history
135.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler broke Virat Kohli's record for smashing most boundaries in an IPL season. Buttler has slammed 124 boundaries (78 fours and 45 sixes) in IPL 2022. He overtook Virat Kohli's record of 122 boundaries (83 fours and 38 sixes) scored in IPL 2016. Buttler also equalled Kohli's record of hitting most centuries (four) in an IPL season.

136.title: Saves me from doing bad Hindi films: Sood on doing more South Indian films
136.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, speaking about why he preferred to do more South Indian films in the last couple of years, said, "South saves me from doing bad Hindi films." "Otherwise there comes a phase when you think you're doing a film just for...sake of being seen in...big film. South helps me from staying away from doing that," Sood added.

137.title: PM Modi is silent on dynasty politics, corruption in BJP: HD Kumaraswamy
137.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy has criticised PM Narendra Modi for commenting on "dynastic politics". "Modi has been speaking about dynasty rule and corruption, but is maintaining a stoic silence on dynasty politics and corruption in his own party (BJP)," Kumaraswamy alleged. He further alleged that the main goal of PM Modi is to finish the regional political parties.

138.title: Exhume body of third person killed in Hyderpora encounter: J&K HC
138.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir HC has directed Union Territory's administration to exhume the body of Amir Latief Magrey, one of the four suspected militants killed in the Hyderpora encounter in November 2021. It ordered the authorities to hand over Magrey's body to his family for burial. While police had said all four deceased were terrorists, their families had dismissed the claims.

139.title: Saha leaves Bengal team's WhatsApp group, wife says he was hurt by official's remark
139.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha has left the WhatsApp group of Bengal Ranji team, with his wife saying he was hurt by CAB's joint-secretary Debabrata Das's remarks. Debabrata had said that Saha has given all sorts of excuses to skip games for the state. Saha recently refused to play for Bengal in the upcoming Ranji knockouts.

140.title: Aryan Khan warned Arbaaz Merchant to not carry drugs on cruise: Chargesheet
140.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan had warned Arbaaz Merchant to not carry drugs on cruise, according to the chargesheet. Merchant has not claimed in any of his statements that the 6gm of charas recovered from his possession was meant for Aryan. Aryan was given clean chit by the NCB in the cruise drugs case.

141.title: Multi-storey building in Noida catches fire after short circuit at ATM kiosk
141.article_body: A multi-storey building was engulfed in fire due to a suspected short circuit at an ATM kiosk located in the building. The four-storey building, which is located in Noida's Bhangel area, has both flats and shops in its complex. However, no casualties were reported and the fire, which broke out at around 10 pm, was brought under control, officials said.

142.title: US must prioritise school security funding over Ukraine aid: Trump
142.article_body: The US should prioritise funding for school security over Ukraine aid, ex-President Donald Trump said, days after 19 students were killed in an elementary school shooting. "If...US has $40 billion to send to Ukraine, we should be able to do whatever it takes to keep our children safe at home," he added. However, Trump rejected calls for tightened gun controls.

143.title: Puppy found with arrow through its neck in US expected to survive; pic surfaces
143.article_body: A four-month-old puppy was found by animal services in US' South Carolina with an arrow through its neck. Officials said that the arrow was nearly as long as the dog's body, adding that the canine is expected to survive. A woman had called 911 early morning on Monday after she heard the puppy "screaming" in pain.

144.title: B'luru NCB busts pan-India drug racket; heroin worth ₹52 cr seized
144.article_body: NCB's Bengaluru Zonal Unit "successfully busted and neutralised" a drug syndicate operating across India based on a single input, the agency said in a statement on Friday. Ten people were arrested and heroin worth over ₹52 crore was seized, it added. The arrests occurred after a woman was apprehended with seven kilograms of heroin at Kempegowda International Airport on Tuesday.

145.title: 4 dead, 2 injured as wall collapses due to cylinder blast in Andhra
145.article_body: At least four people were killed and two others were severely injured after a wall of a house collapsed due to a cylinder blast in Andhra Pradesh's Ananthapuramu, police said. "Due to the impact of the blast, wall of neighbour's residence collapsed...crushed four members to death...severely injured two," police added. The injured were shifted to a hospital for treatment.

146.title: I hope they both move on: Elon Musk on Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's trial
146.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Saturday, while replying to a Twitter user who commented on Amber Heard and Johnny Depp's trial, wrote, "I hope they both move on. At their best, they are each incredible." Musk's comments come after Depp talked about the alleged affair between Heard and Musk in a text message, screenshots of which had also surfaced online.

147.title: Was feeling the pressure midway, got distracted: Buttler on IPL 2022
147.article_body: RR's Jos Buttler said he was under pressure and got distracted midway in IPL 2022. "Some days I have been slow to start with, I wish I was never like that," added Buttler. "Certain times I found it tough," stated Buttler. The opener is IPL 2022's leading run-getter with 824 runs. He scored 106*(60) in the Qualifier 2 against RCB.

148.title: Varun Dhawan urges youngsters to 'Chase the World' with Skybags
148.article_body: Skybags has unveiled its new campaign 'Chase The World' with Varun Dhawan. The ad features fashion-forward bags with bold, colourful, and maximalist designs, the brand revealed. The campaign intends to tap into the desires of an increasing number of youngsters who want to venture out in search of newer experiences. The brand encourages travellers to embrace spontaneity while travelling.

149.title: Send drones there: Owaisi to PM Modi on Chinese infrastructure in Arunachal
149.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's remark that he uses drones for surprise inspections, AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said that the PM must send drones to Ladakh and see how China is building a bridge over our Pangong Tso lake. "PM Modi send a drone to Arunachal, where your best friend Xi Bhai has made his colony on Indian soil," Owaisi added.

150.title: Minor fire breaks out at EV firm Ather Energy's Chennai dealership; all staff safe
150.article_body: A minor fire broke out at Ather Energy’s premises in Chennai on Friday. The Bengaluru-based electric two-wheeler manufacturer tweeted that while some property and scooters got affected, all employees were safe. The company said that it was investigating the cause of the fire but cannot confirm if the battery of one of the vehicles was responsible for it.

151.title: How does the latest World Test Championship points table read?
151.article_body: With Sri Lanka defeating Bangladesh 1-0 in the two-match Test series, Sri Lanka are now fourth on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 55.56% of points won. Bangladesh are eighth on the table, with 16.67% of points won, while England are placed last with 12.5% of points won. India are third on the points table.

152.title: 30 Assam bureaucrats write to Chief Secy over BJP MLA's threat
152.article_body: As many as 30 bureaucrats of Assam's Cachar district administration have written to Chief Secretary Jishnu Barua  over Lakhipur BJP MLA Kaushik Rai's threat. "We would like to bring to your notice...the incident of gross misbehaviour by MLA towards civil servants," they wrote. Rai allegedly assaulted civil servants engaged in relief duty in Sonai amid floods and called them thieves.

153.title: Du Plessis looked like a better leader than Kohli in IPL 2022: Manjrekar
153.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said RCB captain Faf Du Plessis looked like a "better leader" than the team's former captain Virat Kohli in IPL 2022. "Du Plessis is a reliable captain," added Manjrekar. RCB were knocked out of IPL 2022 after a defeat against RR in the Qualifier 2 by seven wickets. RR will take on GT in the final.

154.title: 3 held for blackmailing, extorting money from traffic policemen in Gurugram
154.article_body: Three Delhi residents were held for allegedly trying to blackmail and extort money from two Gurugram traffic policemen. The accused threatened the policemen by claiming to possess a video of the latter allegedly seeking a bribe and demanded ₹3 lakh for not sharing it on social media, police said. Notably, the accused had previously extorted money from several Delhi-based policemen.

155.title: Mangalore University bans hijab in degree colleges after protest
155.article_body: Mangalore University announced on Friday that hijabs will be banned in degree colleges as per Karnataka High Court order after students held a protest. Earlier, the university had let girls wear headscarves matching their uniforms' colours. While headscarves will be allowed on campus, they must be removed before entering buildings on the premises, Vice-Chancellor P Subrahmanya Yadapadithaya said.

156.title: Policemen waited for nearly an hour before killing gunman who shot 19 kids dead in US
156.article_body: Around 20 policemen waited in the hallway for nearly an hour before entering and killing the gunman who shot 19 kids dead at an elementary school in US' Texas, authorities said on Friday. "From the benefit of hindsight where I'm sitting now, of course, it was not the right decision," Steven McCraw, Director of Texas Department of Public Safety, said.

157.title: Lithuanians raise funds to buy drone for Ukraine
157.article_body: Lithuanians have raised some €3 million in three days, out of the €5 million needed, to buy an advanced military drone for Ukraine. "This is the first case in history when ordinary people are raising money to buy something like a Bayraktar...it's unbelievable," Ukraine's ambassador to Lithuania, Beshta Petro, said. The fundraiser was started by Lithuanian internet broadcaster, Laisves TV.

158.title: Punjab govt withdraws security cover of 424 VIPs with immediate effect
158.article_body: Punjab government has withdrawn the security cover of 424 VIPs with immediate effect. They include retired police officers, religious leaders and political leaders. Former Punjab DGP PC Dogra and Majitha MLA Ganieve Kaur are on the list. The concerned police personnel have been directed to report to Special DGP State Armed Police, JRC at Jalandhar Cantt on Saturday.

159.title: Centre to hand over stolen antiquities, idols to Tamil Nadu government
159.article_body: The central government will hand over 10 stolen antiquities to Tamil Nadu government next week, officials said. Out of these, four objects were retrieved from Australia in 2020-2022 and six from US last year. The retrieved items include an idol of Dvārapāla of the Vijayanagar dynasty and a sculpture of Natarāja dating back to 11th-12th century, among others.

160.title: Parents kill daughter over inter-faith relationship in T'gana; held
160.article_body: A couple was arrested for allegedly murdering their 20-year-old daughter over her inter-faith relationship with a Muslim man in Telangana's Adilabad, police said on Friday. Following a missing complaint, police had recently handed over the woman to her parents after she eloped with the man, a sub-inspector said. The couple slit the deceased's throat with a knife, the sub-inspector added.

161.title: 'Fun and Tasty', 'The Same One' among possible new names for McDonald's in Russia
161.article_body: McDonald's in Russia has registered possible new brand names such as ‘Fun and Tasty’, 'The Same One', 'Just Like That' and ‘Open Checkout’ for the firm taking over its restaurants in the country. McDonald's, which owns 84% of its restaurants in Russia, is selling its nearly 850 stores in the country to a local licensee, Alexander Govor.

162.title: Parents have stopped sending me job posts: Panchayat's Sanvikaa
162.article_body: Actress Sanvikaa, who plays the role of Rinki in web series 'Panchayat', has said her parents wanted her to have a stable job. "They used to keep sending me...employment news links and wanted me to apply for them," she added. Sanvikaa further said following the success of 'Panchayat', her parents are very happy and they've stopped sending her job posts.

163.title: Bangalore University to auction 50 jackfruit trees to generate revenue
163.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming jackfruit season, Bangalore University has decided to auction off 50 jackfruit trees on its 1,000-acre Jnanabharathi campus. Last year, the varsity had tried to auction off the trees but did not gain any revenue due to lack of buyers. The auction will take place on May 31 and bidders are required to pay a ₹5,000 deposit.

164.title: Learnt a lot from Sushmita, she raised 2 daughters despite being alone: Charu
164.article_body: Sushmita Sen's sister-in-law Charu Asopa, who welcomed a baby girl in November 2021, has said she has learnt a lot from Sushmita, especially how well she has raised her two daughters "despite being alone". "She makes me believe...woman can do anything in...life," Charu added. She further said Sushmita was inside the operation theatre during the birth of her baby girl.

165.title: Canadian agency probes Tesla fire in which driver struggled to exit
165.article_body: Canadian government's Transport Canada is probing the cause of a Tesla car fire in Vancouver in which the driver struggled to exit the car and ultimately broke its windows. Following the fire, Transport Canada had its contracted collision and defect investigation team "locate and secure the vehicle". The driver had claimed that his car shut down after an error notification.

166.title: UP govt seeks details of patients with fever, rashes amid monkeypox scare
166.article_body: Amid rising monkeypox cases across the world, the UP government has issued an advisory to health officials of the state and District Magistrates directing them to share information about patients suffering from fever and rashes and asked them to remain alert. As per the advisory, the details of such patients are to be submitted to office of Chief Medical Officer.

167.title: Nobody else has batted so well in IPL's history: Sangakkara on Buttler
167.article_body: Discussing RR opener Jos Buttler's performances in IPL 2022, RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said, "I can't remember anyone else batting this well in...[IPL's history]." "[Buttler's] got all the strokes...[and] understands the game really well," added Sangakkara. Buttler has scored 824 runs in IPL 2022 so far. He scored 106* off 60 balls in the Qualifier 2 against RCB.

168.title: Kangana's 'Dhaakad' collects ₹4,420 on Day 8, sells only 20 tickets across India: Report
168.article_body: Kangana Ranaut-starrer 'Dhaakad' collected only ₹4,420 on the eighth day of its release, selling only 20 tickets across the country, a report said. Overall, Dhaakad has made around ₹3 crore so far. 'Dhaakad' reportedly cost between ₹80 crore and ₹90 crore to make. Directed by Razneesh Ghai, the film also stars Arjun Rampal, Divya Dutta and Saswata Chatterjee.

169.title: How did Virat Kohli perform in IPL 2022 as compared to other seasons?
169.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli scored 341 runs in IPL 2022, the least amount of runs scored by him in last five seasons. He recorded a strike rate of 115.99, the worst strike rate for him since IPL 2012, when his strike rate read 111.65. His batting average of 22.73 in IPL 2022 is his lowest in last 14 seasons.

170.title: US woman who punched, broke flight attendant's teeth jailed
170.article_body: A US woman who punched a flight attendant in the face, breaking her teeth, has been jailed for 15 months. Vyvianna Quinonez assaulted the attendant after she asked the 29-year-old to buckle her seatbelt, stow her tray table and wear her facemask properly during the flight's final descent. Quinonez was also ordered to pay over $30,000 in fines and restitution.

171.title: 2 dead in separate road accidents in Pune
171.article_body: Two people died while two got injured in two separate road accidents that took place in Pune on Friday. At Kunjirwadi on the Pune-Solapur highway, a speeding container killed a 26-year-old man. Meanwhile, in another incident, a water tanker hit a motorbike near the textile market on the Hadapsar Saswad Road, leading to the death of a 19-year-old boy.

172.title: India reports 2,685 new COVID-19 cases, 2,158 recoveries in last 24 hours
172.article_body: India has reported 2,685 COVID-19 cases, 2,158 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,710 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 16,308, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,572, according to the latest data.

173.title: I guess I have trust issues with Bill Gates: Elon Musk
173.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk remarked, "I guess I have some trust issues" with Bill Gates. A Twitter user wrote that she didn’t trust Gates, to which Musk replied, "Since Gates still has a multi-billion dollar short position against Tesla while claiming to help with global warming, I guess I’ve some trust issues with him too."
