174.title: Details of calls made by 2 girls as shooter killed 19 kids at US school released
174.article_body: Officials have released the details of the emergency calls made by two girls as the 18-year-old shooter killed kids at the elementary school in US. The girls called at least half a dozen times from the classrooms asking for police to intervene. Twenty-one people including 19 kids were killed in the mass shooting that took place in Texas' Uvalde.

175.title: 44-yr-old Rajasthan Police constable found hanging from tree in Alwar
175.article_body: A 44-year-old Rajasthan Police head constable, Dhruv Singh Jat, allegedly hanged himself from a tree in Alwar on Friday, police said. He was posted at Udyog Nagar Police Station, police added. Jat left his house on Thursday informing his family that he was going to Jaipur for official work. No suicide note was recovered from the scene, police further said.

176.title: Glenn Maxwell, Mohammed Siraj had a terrible IPL 2022 season: Parthiv
176.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said all-rounder Glenn Maxwell and pacer Mohammed Siraj had a "terrible" IPL 2022 season for RCB. "I was surprised to see RCB retain...Maxwell on the basis of one good season...He has been consistent with his inconsistency," added Parthiv. "He scores big runs after every five seasons," stated Parthiv. Maxwell scored 301 runs in IPL 2022.

177.title: BMC issues ₹5 crore tender for development of Democracy Square
177.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) issued ₹5 crore tender to develop a Democracy Square on the lines of Hutatma Chowk at a traffic island near Azad Maidan junction. The Democracy Square will be spread over 1,000 square metres and will represent the four pillars of democracy. It will have facilities like a viewing gallery, seating space and a selfie point.

178.title: Putin trying to wipe out Ukrainian culture and identity: Biden
178.article_body: US President Joe Biden said Russian President Vladimir Putin is not just trying to take over Ukraine through invasion but is "trying to wipe out" Ukrainian people's identity. Putin is attacking schools,  hospitals and museums "with no other purpose than to eliminate a culture", Biden said. The war is "a direct assault on...fundamental tenets of rule-based international order", he added.

179.title: If Bezos wants to get to orbit, less partying & more work is advisable: Musk
179.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user who asked him if he thought that the world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos was a good person, the world's richest person Elon Musk said, "He’s fine." Musk added, "Does seem like he's spending a lot of time in the hot tub...If he wants to get to orbit, less partying and more work would be advisable."

180.title: RPF busts hawala racket at Kalyan station; over ₹1 cr cash seized
180.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) of central railway busted a hawala racket at Kalyan station and recovered over ₹1 crore cash and jewellery worth over ₹9 lakh, an official said on Friday. "While conducting preventive checks, RPF team apprehended five courier company employees, who were carrying hawala money," the official added. The money was being transported from Hyderabad to Mumbai.

181.title: Over 21,000 private vehicles fined for bus lane violations in Delhi
181.article_body: Over 21,000 private vehicles have been fined for bus lane violations in Delhi in two months, officials said. As many as 391 DTC buses and 328 cluster buses have also been penalised under the drive that started on April 1. Delhi government has earmarked dedicated lanes for buses and goods carriers from 8 am to 10 pm.

182.title: FDA seals company in Pune, seizes items worth ₹7.73 lakh
182.article_body: Food and Drug Administration (FDA) on Friday sealed a company manufacturing products without a licence in Pune, officials said. The agency also seized raw materials used to make bath and make-up products estimated to be worth about ₹7.73 lakh, officials added. "The seized materials were used to manufacture shampoo, conditioner, beard wash, hair treatment and keratin products," an official said.

183.title: Over 5,330 families living in dangerous buildings in Navi Mumbai: Survey
183.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has declared 514 buildings in the city as dangerous. Out of these, 350 are commercial properties, whereas over 5,330 families are residing in 'extremely dangerous' category buildings, according to a survey conducted by the civic body. The NMMC has sent notices to such buildings to evacuate and repair the structures.

184.title: Fan invades pitch and touches Virat Kohli, video goes viral
184.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a fan invading the pitch during RCB and RR's IPL 2022 Qualifier 2 match at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The fan appeared to have touched Virat Kohli's glove while he was batting. The fan was then caught by the security and escorted out of the ground.

185.title: 3 boys drown while swimming in Bengaluru lake; 2 bodies recovered
185.article_body: Three boys, aged between 15 and 17, drowned while swimming in the Doddagubbi lake in Bengaluru. An assistant police sub-inspector told Hindustan Times on Friday that two of the three bodies have been recovered so far. A group of five boys had reportedly gone to the lake for a swim a day earlier when the incident took place.

186.title: 1 dead, 2 injured as roof of building collapses in Delhi's Mundka
186.article_body: A 24-year-old labourer died and two others were severely injured after the roof of an under-construction building collapsed in Delhi's Mundka on Friday. Police said they received a call at the control room around 5 pm following which officials rushed to the spot. "The two injured persons are being treated at a private hospital," DCP (Outer Delhi) Sameer Sharma said.

187.title: Indian Army releases names of personnel who died after bus fell into Ladakh river
187.article_body: The Northern Command of the Indian Army has released the names of seven personnel who lost their lives after the bus carrying them skidded off a road and plunged into the Shyok river in Ladakh. The Northern Command wrote, "#LtGenUpendraDwivedi, #ArmyCdrNC and all ranks of #NorthernComd express deepest condolences to the families of the bravehearts who lost their lives."

188.title: Appreciate India's support in this difficult period: Sri Lanka PM
188.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe expressed his appreciation for India extending support to his nation during "this difficult period". Wickremesinghe tweeted that he had spoken to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and he looked "forward to strengthening ties between" the two nations. He also thanked India and Japan for the move to set up a foreign aid consortium for Sri Lanka.

189.title: 18 more arrested over hate sloganeering at Kerala PFI rally
189.article_body: Police said that 18 more people have been arrested in the case where a video allegedly showed a minor boy raising provocative slogans at a Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Kerala's Alappuzha. "As of now, we have 20 people under arrest," police added. The purported short video shows the boy sitting on the shoulders of a person.

190.title: Axis MF ex-fund manager fired in front-running case sends legal notice to firm
190.article_body: Viresh Joshi, a former fund manager at Axis Mutual Fund who was fired after being suspended on allegations of front-running, has sent a legal notice to the company against his "unlawful termination". Axis AMC, one of India's leading mutual funds, is facing allegations of front-running. It earlier said it has been conducting a suo moto internal investigation since February 2022.

191.title: Foetus sex detection racket busted in Odisha, 13 arrested
191.article_body: Police said that 13 people including a noted public health activist were arrested after a foetus sex determination racket was busted in Odisha's Berhampur. Police said that the main suspect, Durga Prasad Nayak, who runs the clinic at his residence, was found conducting tests using ultrasound machines. Eleven pregnant women were present at the house during the raid, police added.

192.title: Nothing is normal in J&K: Omar Abdullah after Amreen's killing
192.article_body: After TV artiste Amreen Bhat was shot dead by terrorists in Budgam, former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said that "nothing is normal" in the Union Territory. "Areas in and around Srinagar used to be free of militancy. Now incidents are happening one after the other," Omar Abdullah said. "There is no justification for such incidents," he added.

193.title: India responds to OIC criticism on Yasin Malik verdict, says 'don't justify terror'
193.article_body: The government on Friday issued a statement after the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) criticised the life imprisonment sentence given to Yasin Malik in a terror funding case. Calling the Islamic nations group's comments "unacceptable", India said, "The world seeks zero tolerance of terrorism and we urge OIC not to justify it in any manner."

194.title: Baby born with 'permanent smile' due to rare condition in Australia, pics surface
194.article_body: A baby named Ayla Summer Mucha was born in December 2021 in Australia with bilateral macrostomia, where the corners of mouth don't fuse together during pregnancy. The rare condition makes it seem as though she has a 'permanent smile'. According to New York Post, a study published in Cleft Palate-Craniofacial Journal in 2007 noted just 14 cases of this condition.

195.title: Man kills his mother with a wooden plank in Odisha, arrested
195.article_body: Police said that a 30-year-old man, identified as Jitendra Kanhar, allegedly killed his mother with a wooden plank in Odisha's Kandhamal district. Police added that Kanhar, who often quarrelled with his 61-year-old mother, hit her with a wooden plank in a fit of rage following an argument. "Kanhar was arrested and an investigation is underway," Phulbani Sub-Divisional Police Officer said.

196.title: India delivers over 25 tonnes of medical supplies to Sri Lanka
196.article_body: India on Friday delivered over 25 tonnes of medical supplies to Sri Lanka as part of its ongoing efforts to provide aid to the country amid an economic crisis. The supplies also include kerosene for use by Sri Lankan fishermen, the High Commission of India in Colombo said. "These supplies will be distributed among the beneficiaries in...coming days," it added.

197.title: Jos Buttler smashes hundred as RR defeat RCB to reach IPL final after 14 years
197.article_body: RR defeated RCB by seven wickets in the Qualifier 2 to reach the final of IPL 2022. RCB put up a total of 157/8, with RR chasing it down in 18.1 overs, driven by Jos Buttler's 106*(60). RR have reached an IPL final after 14 years. They had defeated CSK in the final of the inaugural edition in 2008.

198.title: Isolated high impact accidents: Ola on claims of scooter's front fork failure
198.article_body: Ola Electric has responded after a Twitter user claimed that the front suspension of his Ola S1 Pro scooter broke during low-speed driving. The company said that the recent incidents were caused due to "isolated high impact accidents" and that its scooters undergo rigorous quality assessment. The user had sought "replacement or design change" and claimed Ola used "poor material".

199.title: Woman stabbed by stalker multiple times on busy road in Hyd, attack caught on CCTV
199.article_body: A 48-year-old woman was stabbed multiple times on a busy road in Hyderabad and CCTV footage of the same has emerged. The man who attacked her is her neighbour, who, as per her family, had allegedly been harassing and stalking her. The family said they had earlier filed a police complaint against the man, who was arrested but released later.

200.title: Russia needs huge financial resources for operation in Ukraine: Minister
200.article_body: Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov on Friday said that Russia needs huge financial resources for its military operation in Ukraine. The war in Ukraine had prompted the West to impose sanctions on the Russian economy in an effort to discourage Russia from continuing the conflict. The Russian economy has been pushed to the brink of recession, according to Reuters.

201.title: Tesla won't make cars in India if we aren't allowed to sell and service first: Musk
201.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a Twitter user who asked about Tesla's plans for a manufacturing plant in India and said, "Tesla will not put a manufacturing plant in any location where we aren't allowed first to sell and service cars." Earlier, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said Tesla is welcome to India, make cars for sale and export them.

202.title: 11 injured, vehicles damaged as 2 families clash over ₹2,100 in MP
202.article_body: Police said that 11 people were injured and 15 motorcycles were damaged after two families clashed over ₹2,100 in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Thursday night. "One Kishore Chohan along with his eight relatives had a heated argument with Narendra Mundel over ₹2,100," Simrol Police Station Inspector said. Later, Mundel, accompanied by around 90 persons, attacked Chohan's group, he added.

203.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh completes sea sortie in submarine
203.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh completed a sea sortie in a submarine on Friday, describing the experience as "wonderful and thrilling". "Spent hours under the sea and witnessed the combat capabilities...of...Kalvari class submarine," he tweeted. "After having the firsthand insight into the under water capabilities of the Indian Navy, I'm more assured of India's security," he said.

204.title: Sincere condolences: Mamata as 7 Army soldiers killed in Ladakh
204.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee condoled the death of seven soldiers who died in a road accident in Ladakh on Friday. "Sincere condolences for the bereaved, solidarity for all," she tweeted. Army officials said that seven soldiers were killed and several others were injured when their vehicle skidded off the road and fell into the Shyok River in Ladakh.

205.title: Uttarakhand govt forms panel to prepare draft on Uniform Civil Code
205.article_body: Uttarakhand government has formed a committee to prepare a draft on the implementation of Uniform Civil Code in the state. The committee, headed by retired Supreme Court Justice Ranjana Desai, will prepare a draft soon and we'll implement the UCC immediately, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said. The UCC would be implemented for everybody, irrespective of their religion, he added.

206.title: It's no joke: Varun Dhawan on Pak singer's plagiarism allegation
206.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has responded to Pakistani singer Abrar Ul Haq's plagiarism allegations against the 'Jug Jugg Jeeyo' song 'Nach Punjaban', saying, "It's no joke. All the processes have been followed." Following Abrar's allegation, music label T-Series released an official statement dismissing the claims, stating that they legally acquired the rights to adapt the song from the original album.

207.title: I'm not satisfied: GT pacer Yash Dayal on his IPL 2022 performance
207.article_body: GT pacer Yash Dayal, who has taken 10 wickets from eight matches in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 9.59, said he's not satisfied with his performance. "I am trying to contribute well with a good economy rate. But sometimes I gave away too many runs," he added. The 24-year-old is playing in his maiden IPL.

208.title: Tesla won't make cars in a location where we can't sell first: Musk on India plans
208.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a Twitter user who asked about Tesla's plans for a manufacturing plant in India and said, "Tesla will not put a manufacturing plant in any location where we aren't allowed first to sell and service cars." Earlier, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said Tesla is welcome to India, make cars for sale and export them.

209.title: Calcutta University students protest, demand online exams
209.article_body: Around 200 students of Calcutta University (CU) protested outside the university's main campus at College Street, demanding online examinations. "Classes were held on campus only for two months and we are expected to write papers based on the whole syllabus," a student said. CU Vice-Chancellor said that a decision will be taken after getting opinions from all stakeholders.

210.title: Why is Guj becoming gateway of drugs?: Cong on 52kg drug seizure
210.article_body: After 52 kilograms of cocaine was seized from Gujarat's Mundra Port, Congress' spokesperson Pawan Khera asked, "Why is Gujarat becoming the gateway of drugs in India?" "We're not trying to corner the government…we're trying to protect [India's future generations]," he added. Meanwhile, BJP's spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said, "Drugs are caught in Gujarat because the government is acting strictly."

211.title: MP to hold three-tier panchayat polls from June 25 to July 8
211.article_body: The State Election Commission (SEC) has announced that the three-tier panchayat polls in Madhya Pradesh will be held in three phases. The polling for the first phase will be held on June 25, while the polling for the second and third phases will be conducted on July 1 and July 8, respectively. The nomination process will start from May 30.

212.title: Don't think apology coming from media: Atul on Aryan's clean chit
212.article_body: Fashion photographer and producer Atul Kasbekar has tweeted in support of Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan after the latter got a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. Atul wrote, "Now that there's a complete clean chit for #AryanKhan...I don't suppose there's an apology...forthcoming from...media channels that were crucifying the kid in this flimsy case?"

213.title: He has marshalled his troops well: Shastri on RCB captain Du Plessis
213.article_body: Ravi Shastri lauded RCB captain Faf du Plessis for tackling the tight situation in the Eliminator against LSG. "They kept their nerves towards their end. I thought Faf's calmness was brilliant...he was very good with the way he marshalled his troops," he stated. "Just his influence on the game to back the calmness was good to see," added Shastri.

214.title: Which countries have reported monkeypox cases so far?
214.article_body: Over 200 monkeypox cases have been reported in at least 21 countries with Finland confirming its first case on Friday. Australia, Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Portugal, Slovenia and Spain are among the affected nations. Sweden, Switzerland, the UK, the US, Canada, Israel, UAE and Argentina have also reported cases of the virus.

215.title: People steal gram sacks from truck after accident in Chhattisgarh
215.article_body: Following a collision between two trucks in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur on Friday, several people were  allegedly seen stealing sacks from one of the trucks in a video that has surfaced online. The truck was loaded with 'chana' (gram). "A case of theft and accident has been registered. The stolen material will be recovered soon," Bilaspur ASP Umesh Kashyap said.

216.title: Indians would've killed him with trolling: Aly Goni on Depp-Heard case
216.article_body: Television actor Aly Goni took to Instagram Stories on Friday to share a video of fans cheering for Johnny Depp outside the courthouse amid his ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. Aly wrote alongside the video, "It's a good thing that it didn't happen in India otherwise people would have killed him with trolling because of this. #MardBhiInsaanHai #JohnnyDepp."

217.title: I know I don't have anyone to fall back on: Manushi Chhillar
217.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar, who will make her Bollywood debut in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', has stated that she knows she doesn't have anyone to fall back on. "I was clear in my head about one thing that if people were to give me work, it would purely be because they want to work with me," the actress added.

218.title: 5,500-year-old tree believed to be world's oldest found in Chile, pics released
218.article_body: A tree that is up to 5,484 years old has been found in a forest in southern Chile and it is believed to be the world's oldest tree, as per a new study. The age of the ancient alerce tree known as "great grandfather" beats the current record-holder, which is a 4,853-year-old bristlecone pine tree in California.

219.title: Monkeypox can be contained if we act now, says WHO
219.article_body: Speaking about the monkeypox outbreaks globally, a World Health Organization (WHO) official on Friday said, "We think that if we put in place...right measures now we probably can contain this easily." Early detection and isolation of cases and contact tracing are needed, the official added. The official also called on countries to share data about their vaccine stockpiles.

220.title: Knock out by dad: Dhawan as father jokingly beats him after PBKS exit IPL 2022
220.article_body: After his team Punjab Kings (PBKS) failed to qualify for the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2022 playoffs, Shikhar Dhawan shared a video on Instagram. In the video, Dhawan can be seen being playfully beaten by his father while others try to stop him. "Knock out by my dad for not qualifying for knockouts," Dhawan jokingly captioned the video.

221.title: Truth prevails: Pooja Bhatt on Aryan Khan's clean chit in drugs case
221.article_body: Actress-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt has reacted to Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan getting a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case, tweeting, "#truthprevails." She further wrote, "Sameer [Wankhede]...Probably very busy being a righteous,publicity shy officer elsewhere...And who better than the least corrupt of them all to cure society of all evil & rot. Except this time,no selfies allowed."

222.title: 5,000 Ukrainian prisoners held in breakaway region: Separatist leader
222.article_body: More than 5,000 Ukrainian prisoners of war were being held in the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic, according to a separatist leader in eastern Ukraine. Russia had recognised Donetsk as an independent republic days before it launched the invasion of Ukraine. Notably, there have been a few instances of exchange of prisoners between Russia and Ukraine amid the war.

223.title: It exposed inefficiency, recklessness of NCB: RGV on Aryan's clean chit
223.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to react to Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan getting a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. He wrote, "The...good thing which came about...is him being a celebrity's son. It helped in...exposing the inefficiency and recklessness of...agencies subjecting innocent people to harassment which otherwise...people can't and won't know of."

224.title: This is for Sri Lankans: Karunarathna on SL's 1-0 Test series win vs B'desh
224.article_body: Following Sri Lanka's 1-0 Test series win against Bangladesh, Sri Lanka skipper Dimuth Karunarathna took to Twitter and wrote, "I would like to dedicate the win to all Sri Lankans." He added, "We are having a tough time there. This win brings some joy to their faces." Notably, Sri Lanka is currently experiencing its worst economic crisis in history.

225.title: Venkatesh told me last season, 'Patidar is a brilliant player': Harbhajan
225.article_body: Talking about Rajat Patidar, Harbhajan Singh said Venkatesh Iyer had told him about the RCB batter during IPL 2021. "He told me, 'He's a brilliant player...can single-handedly win the match for his team'...that innings[112*], against LSG, showed that the player has a lot of capability," he added. Patidar was picked as a replacement for injured Luvnith Sisodia in IPL 2022.

226.title: AAP's free electricity offer troubling Gujarat BJP chief: Kejriwal
226.article_body: AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday took to Twitter and asked why his offer to provide free electricity to the people of Gujarat was "troubling" state BJP chief CR Patil. "There is huge corruption in Gujarat government," Kejriwal added. His remarks come after Patil recently cautioned people against getting influenced by freebies offered by "some political leaders".

227.title: IAS officer wades through mud to inspect flood-hit areas in Assam, pics go viral
227.article_body: Pictures of an IAS officer visiting flood-affected areas in Assam's Cachar have gone viral on Twitter, with many users and civil servants praising her efforts. Cachar district's Deputy Commissioner Keerthi Jalli is seen wading through mud to interact with locals to understand their problems. Locals reportedly said this was the first time a Deputy Commissioner visited them.

228.title: NHRC notice to Maha as 4 kids test HIV +ve after blood transfusion
228.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has taken suo motu cognisance of a media report which stated that four thalassemic children tested HIV positive in Maharashtra's Nagpur allegedly after blood transfusions and one of them died. The NHRC has issued a notice to the state Chief Secretary, calling for a detailed report in the matter within six weeks.

229.title: Nykaa's Q4 net profit falls 49% to ₹8.56 crore, revenue rises to ₹973 crore
229.article_body: Beauty e-commerce startup Nykaa's parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures Ltd reported that the net profit attributable to its shareholders dropped 49% year-on-year to ₹8.56 crore in the quarter ended March. While the company's revenue from operations rose 31% year-on-year to ₹973 crore, its expenses rose to about ₹979 crore from ₹725 crore a year earlier.

230.title: 'Prithviraj' renamed to 'Samrat Prithviraj' over Karni Sena's demand
230.article_body: The makers of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' have renamed the film to 'Samrat Prithviraj' following the demand from Karni Sena. A letter penned by YRF CEO addressed to Karni Sena's National, Youth and State Presidents has surfaced. It reads, "We are highly appreciative of the mutual agreement reached between us that you have no further objections with regards to our Film."

231.title: Anguished: PM Modi on death of 7 soldiers in Ladakh accident
231.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his condolences over the death of seven Indian Army soldiers in a road accident in Ladakh. PM said he's anguished by the loss of the army personnel, adding, "My thoughts are with...bereaved families." The accident occurred in Ladakh's Turtuk village when the vehicle in which the soldiers were travelling fell into the Shyok river, reports said.

232.title: No monkeypox cases in India yet, no need to panic: ICMR scientist
232.article_body: A scientist of the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) advised people not to panic over monkeypox, adding, "In India, we haven't had any case yet." "We are having cases in non-endemic countries of Europe and the USA," ICMR scientist Dr Aparna Mukherjee said. The government is keeping a watch, she added.

233.title: Ex-Tripura MLA Ashish Das quits TMC, says 'can't survive in TMC'
233.article_body: Former Tripura MLA Ashish Das on Friday quit the Trinamool Congress (TMC), stating that "it's no longer possible for him to survive in the party". He said that the TMC leadership "doesn't give due respect" to its leaders, adding, "They (party leadership) don't even consider us human beings." Das had quit the BJP to join the TMC in October 2021.

234.title: J&K's situation deteriorating: Mufti after meeting Amreen's family
234.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti met the family members of TV artiste Amreen Bhat, who was killed by terrorists in Budgam and said "situation is deteriorating" in the valley. "Innocent people are being killed every day," Mufti said. Criticising the Centre, she said, "Government keeps blowing its trumpet of normalcy in Jammu and Kashmir even when such gruesome incidents suggest otherwise."

235.title: 1st transgender Barbie designed after actress Laverne Cox, pic released
235.article_body: Laverne Cox has made history by becoming Mattel's first-ever transgender Barbie. The actress and LGBTQ rights-advocate got this recognition just a few days before her 50th birthday later this week. The company described Cox as "a four-time Emmy-nominated actress, Emmy-winning producer, and the first transgender woman of colour to have a leading role on a scripted TV show".

236.title: Argentina reports Latin America's 1st confirmed monkeypox case: AP
236.article_body: Argentina on Friday reported Latin America's first confirmed case of monkeypox in a resident of Buenos Aires province, according to The Associated Press. The man had travelled to Spain recently, according to authorities. Notably, nearly 200 cases of monkeypox have been reported in more than 20 countries so far, the World Health Organization (WHO) said.

237.title: 'Was filmed without consent by coach's trainee', says gymnast Reddy; probe launched
237.article_body: Gymnast Aruna Budda Reddy has alleged that she was videographed without her consent during a physical fitness test in March, by a trainee of coach Rohit Jaiswal. The Sports Authority of India (SAI) has formed a three-member inquiry committee to look into the allegations. Reddy had threatened legal action after Jaiswal got a clean chit from Gymnastics Federation of India.

238.title: Deeply saddened: Rajnath on death of 7 soldiers in Ladakh accident
238.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said he was "deeply saddened" by the loss of lives of seven Indian Army soldiers due to an accident in Ladakh's Turtuk village. "We will never forget their exemplary service to our nation," he added. "My condolences to the bereaved families and prayers for the speedy recovery of the injured," the minister further said.

239.title: Dismissed Punjab Health Minister sent to 14-day judicial custody
239.article_body: A Mohali court has sent former Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla to 14-day judicial custody till June 10. Vijay was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Branch after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed him from the state Cabinet over alleged corruption charges. Singla was allegedly demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, CM Mann's office had said.

240.title: I feel like my baby was taken away from me: Bose on being fired as Zilingo CEO
240.article_body: Ankiti Bose, the Co-founder of Singapore-based Zilingo who was fired as CEO last week, said, "I feel like my baby has been taken away from me without giving me a proper explanation or a chance to fight for her back." Bose told Bloomberg she's "grieving and fighting" for herself simultaneously. Bose, who was fired for "serious financial irregularities", denied wrongdoing.

241.title: 4 killed, 7 injured as auto-rickshaw overturns in Andhra's Krishna
241.article_body: Police said that four people were killed and seven others were injured when the auto-rickshaw they were travelling in overturned while trying to overtake another vehicle in Andhra Pradesh's Krishna district. Avanigadda DSP Mahaboob Basha said that 20 people were travelling in the auto-rickshaw at the time of the accident. Three women and a man died on the spot.

242.title: Boney Kapoor's credit card fraudulently used for transactions worth ₹3.82 lakh
242.article_body: An aide of producer Boney Kapoor has filed a complaint against an unidentified person after the latter's credit card was fraudulently used to carry out transactions totalling ₹3.82 lakh. The accused has used the credit card to carry out five online transactions. Kapoor found out about it when an executive from his bank called up for credit card bill payment.

243.title: Things are falling in place for RCB: Manjrekar ahead of Qualifier 2
243.article_body: On being asked why he predicted RCB would win Qualifier 2 against RR in IPL 2022, Sanjay Manjrekar said things are falling in place for Faf du Plessis-led side. "They have class bowlers, they performed well in the last match where Mohammed Siraj took a crucial wicket," he added. Manjrekar further said that Harshal Patel is the team's trump card.

244.title: Delhi approves ₹16 crore-project for strengthening 12 city roads
244.article_body: The Delhi government has approved a project worth ₹16.03 crore for strengthening 12 key roads in the capital, including the stretch in front of the Akshardham Temple that connects Delhi with Noida. Public Works Department (PWD) officials said these 12 stretches will be overhauled in a way that the area is also decongested. Potholes will also be filled, officials added.

245.title: ED attaches Pune firm's assets worth ₹62.7 cr in bank fraud case
245.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued an order to attach assets worth ₹62.7 crore belonging to a Pune-based firm over its alleged involvement in a bank fraud case. The investigation was launched in 2020 after the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), Pune wing registered an FIR. The fraud was committed at the Andhra Bank.

246.title: RR to bowl first against RCB in IPL 2022 Qualifier 2, playing XIs announced
246.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in the Qualifier 2 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday. Both the teams are fielding an unchanged side. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will face Gujarat Titans (GT) in the final on Sunday.

247.title: Pune civic body's Fire Dept received 482 calls in April and May
247.article_body: The Fire Department of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has received 482 calls in April and May this year. "The main reason for the rise in the number of incidents of fire in the city is the rise in temperature," the department's Assistant Divisional Officer said. Last year, the department reported 313 cases in April and May.

248.title: I've a gut feeling RCB will go all the way: Harbhajan ahead of RCB-RR
248.article_body: Ahead of Qualifier 2 between RCB and RR in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh said, "I've a gut feeling that RCB will go all the way this season. And if they do, they'll probably lift the cup." He added that current RCB team has very good players, who can win the trophy for them. Match will be played in Ahmedabad today.

249.title: Brand accused of copying artwork used in Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's Cannes outfit
249.article_body: A Kolkata-based brand Bobo Calcutta has been accused of plagiarising the artwork that was embroidered on a jacket worn by Aishwarya Rai Bachchan at Cannes this year. Bengaluru-based artist Nidhi Jacob has accused the ready-to-wear label of copying her artwork without paying her. She also noted that the brand even copied her choice of colours.

250.title: Sri Lanka beat Bangladesh by 10 wickets in 2nd Test, win series 1-0
250.article_body: Sri Lanka beat hosts Bangladesh by 10 wickets in second Test in Dhaka on Friday to win the two match series 1-0. After Sri Lanka took a first-innings lead of 141, they bowled out Bangladesh for 169 in their second innings. The visitors chased the 29-run target in three overs. Fast bowler Asitha Fernando took 10 wickets in the match.

251.title: We've decided to work together: Kejriwal on meeting Delhi's new LG
251.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday met the newly-appointed Lieutenant Governor of Delhi Vinai Kumar Saxena. Informing about the same, Kejriwal said, "We discussed several issues and decided to work together for...betterment of...[Delhi's people]." Saxena, who took oath as the 22nd Lt Governor of Delhi on Thursday, had said that he'll work as a "local guardian" in the national capital.

252.title: Indian peacekeepers thwart attack by rebel group in DR Congo
252.article_body: UN peacekeepers from India and other nations have thwarted an attack by a rebel group in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), a senior UN official said. The M23 group has been active in the last couple of weeks in eastern DRC, the official added. The UN is following the situation very closely, the official further said.

253.title: 9-year-old girl dies as houseboat catches fire in J&K's Dal Lake
253.article_body: A nine-year-old girl was charred to death after a houseboat in Dal Lake in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar caught fire on Friday, officials said. According to officials, fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire soon after getting information. An investigation is underway to determine the exact cause of the fire.

254.title: Man arrested for selling narcotics in B'luru, 90 grams MDMA seized
254.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have arrested a person who was allegedly involved in the sale of narcotics, the city's Deputy Commissioner of Police (West Division) Sanjeev M Patil said. Police have recovered 90 grams MDMA, 33 grams brown sugar, 300 grams opium and a two-wheeler from his possession, he added. Patil has also shared a picture of the seized items.

255.title: I'd be lucky: Samantha to troll who said she will die alone
255.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu has responded to a social media user who trolled her by writing in a now-deleted tweet, "She's gonna end up dying alone with cats and dogs." The actress replied, "I would consider myself lucky." Samantha had announced her split from husband actor Naga Chaitanya in October 2021 ahead of their fourth wedding anniversary.

256.title: Ex-Maha minister Deshmukh complains of chest pain, admitted to ICU
256.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has been admitted to ICU at Mumbai's KEM Hospital on Friday after he complained of chest pain, high blood pressure and shoulder pain. According to officials, Deshmukh will undergo a stress test shortly. As per an official statement released by the hospital, his condition is being monitored closely.

257.title: So damn uncool to fat shame: Malaika on Amrita getting trolled
257.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora has shared her sister Amrita Arora's Instagram story on receiving "hate" over her weight gain. Malaika wrote, "You say it sis... [You're] beautiful [just] the way you are... [And] guys it's so damn uncool to fat shame anyone... Tch Tch." Amrita also reacted to trolls calling her "old", writing, "So buddhi is meant to be an insult??"

258.title: Ex-Twitter India head steps down as CEO of his edtech startup Invact Metaversity
258.article_body: Invact Metaversity on Friday said its Co-founder Manish Maheshwari is stepping down as CEO and Director. Former Twitter India head Maheshwari and Co-founder Tanay Pratap "had diverging visions" for the edtech startup's long-term prospects, Invact said. "It's heartbreaking for a founder to leave the startup, like a mother leaving her baby. I'm going through the same emotion," Maheshwari tweeted.

259.title: 16th seeds Bopanna-Middelkoop enter French Open pre-quarterfinals
259.article_body: India's Rohan Bopanna and his Dutch partner Matwe Middelkoop entered the men's doubles pre-quarterfinals at French Open. They defeated Andrey Golubev and Fabrice Martin 6-3, 6-4 in second round on Thursday. The Indo-Dutch duo, seeded 16th, will now face second seeds Nikola Mektic and Mate Pavic. Meanwhile, Indo-American pair of Ramkumar Ramanathan and Hunter Reese lost in the second round.

260.title: Dunzo Daily disrupts the grocery delivery market: Dunzo
260.article_body: Freshness is the need of the hour, and Dunzo Daily is delivering the freshest fruits, vegetables, dairy, meat, and daily provisions to your doorstep in 19 min with up to 50% off and free home delivery, Dunzo announced. Choose from a wide range of top quality products and groceries the smart way with Dunzo Daily, they added.

261.title: Share of ₹2,000 notes in circulation falls as RBI prints no new notes for 3rd year
261.article_body: The share of India's highest denomination currency note in circulation is continuing to drop as the RBI has not printed any new ₹2,000 note since 2019-20, according to the central bank's annual report for 2021-22. As of March 31, there were 214 crore notes of ₹2,000 denomination in circulation, compared with 245 crore notes a year ago, the report showed.

262.title: 4 suspects arrested in Tamil Nadu BJP functionary's murder case
262.article_body: The Greater Chennai Police has arrested four people in connection with the murder of 33-year-old Tamil Nadu BJP SC Wing's District Secretary (Chennai Central) Balachander in Chintadripet. The deceased had seven criminal cases, including two related to attempt to murder, against him. He was provided with an armed guard by police after he complained of threat to his life.

263.title: Is 'buddhi' meant to be an insult: Amrita Arora on being age-shamed over latest pic
263.article_body: Actress Amrita Arora has reacted to social media users, who body-shamed her and called her "old" in the comments section of her latest post. Amrita wrote, "So buddhi is meant to be an insult??...For me it's just a word...that means old?" "Also got...lot of hate on my weight gain! I own it...I love it...my weight my problem!" she added.

264.title: 50% dip in kidney transplants after Ruby Hall case: Pune doctors
264.article_body: Pune city doctors have said that there has been at least a 50% decline in the number of live kidney transplants in the city. This comes after a case related to alleged malpractices in a kidney transplant procedure at Ruby Hall Clinic was reported in Pune. So far, police have arrested two persons in connection with the kidney transplant case.

265.title: Certain types of films don't define your place in industry anymore: Yami
265.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, in a recent interview, said the industry is now heading in a positive direction. There isn't that notion anymore that certain types of films will define an actor's place in the industry, Yami said, adding that the audience is extremely welcoming. "Even the industry is now opening up to the idea that everybody can co-exist," she added.

266.title: Didn't have any daily soap to do: Rubina Dilaik on doing 'Khatron...'
266.article_body: TV actress Rubina Dilaik said she is doing 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' as she didn't have any daily soap to do at present. Further, while talking about her show 'Shakti', she added that she would always prefer quality over quantity. "Weather I...sit at home or wait, I'll only pick...projects that I can contribute to with my full heart," Rubina said.

267.title: I only did 'Kaabil' because it starred Hrithik Roshan: Yami Gautam
267.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has stated that she had been told to "work with only certain names", adding she did Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Kaabil' because of this advice. The actress added that she did it but it didn't work for her. Yami further said that she had a very good role in the film but people said she had "very less role".

268.title: One of those innings that'll last a long time: Faf on Patidar's 112*(54)
268.article_body: Praising Rajat Patidar for his unbeaten 112 off 54 balls in Eliminator against LSG in IPL 2022,  RCB captain Faf du Plessis said his teammate's innings was remarkable. "Just one of those innings that will last a very long time. We were all just in awe watching him," he added. RCB defeated LSG by 14 runs at Eden Gardens.

269.title: Terminally-ill British man gets ‘world’s first’ double hand transplant
269.article_body: Steven Gallagher (48) from Scotland, who suffers from scleroderma, an autoimmune disease that causes scarring of skin and internal organs, got a double hand transplant. The 12-hour operation took place in December 2021 after a suitable donor was found. According to hospital, it's first time in the world that hands of a person terminally affected by scleroderma have been replaced.

270.title: Hyderabad man jailed for 5 days for stalking, harassing woman
270.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad sentenced a 36-year-old man, J Nagesh, to five days imprisonment for stalking and harassing a woman. Police said Nagesh initially catcalled the woman and then started harassing her in the guise of introducing her to weight reduction techniques. Following her complaint, the She Team and the local police identified Nagesh using his bike registration number.

271.title: RBI includes 'work from anywhere' policy for staff in its agenda for 2022-23
271.article_body: The RBI in its annual report that was released on Friday stated "working from anywhere" under its agenda for 2022-2023. While it had operationalised work from home during COVID-19, the annual report further stated, "The roadmap for the year would include…To devise a policy on 'working from anywhere' for building a seamless work environment as part of business continuity planning."

272.title: Yoga Utsav held in Hyd to mark 25-day countdown to Int'l Yoga Day
272.article_body: Over 10,000 people in Hyderabad joined the Yoga Utsav to mark the 25-day countdown to International Yoga Day. The event was organised by the Ministry of Ayush with the support of the Telangana government. The event was held under the theme 'Make Yoga a part of your life', and many politicians and celebrities attended the event.

273.title: Some edtech startups weren't mature: Screwvala on recent layoffs
273.article_body: Ronnie Screwvala, upGrad Chairperson, in an interview discussing funding winter in the startup ecosystem and the recent layoffs by some edtech startups, said one or two firms in the edtech space didn't have the maturity to anticipate challenges. His statements follow the recent layoffs by Vedantu and Unacademy. "Startups, VCs were in La La Land," Screwvala added.

274.title: 52 kgs of cocaine worth ₹500 crore seized at Gujarat's Mundra Port
274.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized 52 kilograms of cocaine worth around ₹500 crore, hidden in a consignment of salt shipped from Iran, at Mundra Port in Gujarat's Kutch. After a three-day-long investigation under 'Operation Namkeen', some of the 1,000 bags officials examined were found to be suspicious, as a substance having distinct smell was found in them.

275.title: KL Rahul's 6-hitting ability is more than Kieron Pollard: Harbhajan
275.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh said LSG captain KL Rahul often plays the role of an anchor, but his 'six-hitting' ability is more than MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard. Discussing LSG's loss against RCB by 14 runs in IPL 2022's Eliminator, Harbhajan stated, "Lucknow played [slowly] in the initial six overs...[and] missed a trick by not scoring more runs in the powerplay."

276.title: Aim is to take wicket when team needs me: Arshdeep on T20Is vs SA
276.article_body: PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh, who was selected in India's 18-member squad for five-match T20I series against South Africa, said his aim is to take a wicket whenever the team needs him in series. "Waiting for my debut," he added. Arshdeep's death-overs economy rate of 7.58 is only behind Jasprit Bumrah(7.38) for bowlers with at least eight overs in IPL 2022.

277.title: Taliban dismiss UNSC's call to reverse restrictions on Afghan women
277.article_body: The Taliban has rejected the UN Security Council's call to reverse "practices which are currently restricting the human rights and fundamental freedoms of Afghan women and girls". The Security Council's concerns are "unfounded", the Taliban government said. Earlier this month, the Taliban ordered women to cover their faces in public and asked them not to leave their homes unless necessary.

278.title: Wimbledon to drop titles 'Miss', 'Mrs' on its honours board: Report
278.article_body: Wimbledon has reportedly decided to drop the titles "Miss" and "Mrs" before the names of the female players on its honours board. The move has been aimed in an attempt to modernise the tournament. Notably, no titles are used against the names of the male players on the All England Lawn Tennis Club's honours board.

279.title: Sanjay Raut declares assets worth ₹21.14 crore ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
279.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut declared assets worth ₹21.14 crore while filing his nomination for the Rajya Sabha polls. Raut has ₹1,55,872 in cash and ₹1,93,55,809 as bank deposits, his election affidavit stated. He further owns one vehicle purchased in 2004, two revolvers and three parcels of agricultural land in Alibaug. Also, Raut's wife owns a 0.73-acre plot in Palghar.

280.title: MBBS degree holder cheated of ₹52 lakh in Gurugram; 5 booked
280.article_body: A Gurugram-based MBBS degree holder was allegedly cheated of ₹52 lakh on the pretext of getting a seat in a PG course, police said. The accused had reportedly promised him that they would help him in getting the seat under the management quota at a private medical college in West Bengal. Meanwhile, police have booked five people in the case.

281.title: Do not exaggerate Chinese threat: Beijing to US
281.article_body: China asked the US to not "spread misinformation" and "exaggerate the China threat" to restrain the Asian country's development. This comes after US State Secretary Antony Blinken said China poses the "most serious long-term challenge" to the international order. "China has always been, is and will be the defender of the international order," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said.

282.title: His warmth touched my heart: Anupam on pic with Big Bang Theory's Kunal
282.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with 'The Big Bang Theory' actor Kunal Nayyar. "It was...wonderful to meet Kunal Nayyar...Our very own Delhi Boy...His warmth touched my heart," he wrote. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "It'll be fun to see you two working together," while another fan wrote, "The crossover we never expected."

283.title: Chupke Chupke an iconic film, don't want to ruin its legacy: Bhushan on remake
283.article_body: Bhushan Kumar, who had announced a remake of the 1975 film 'Chupke Chupke', has said remaking a classic is a big responsibility. "We're being very careful...It's an iconic film and we don't want to ruin the legacy," he added. The remake will be written by Luv Ranjan, who has penned films like 'De De Pyaar De' and 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'.

284.title: Kartik's fans dance to Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 song in theatre, actor shares video
284.article_body: Kartik Aaryan took to his Instagram Stories to share a video showing his fans dancing to the title track of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' in a theatre. In the video, two women could be seen matching Kartik's steps when the song is played in the theatre along with the end credits. "Killed it," Kartik wrote while sharing the video.

285.title: Goa pastor, wife arrested for luring people to convert to Christianity
285.article_body: Police arrested Pastor Domnic D'Souza and his wife Joan on Thursday for allegedly luring people to convert to Christianity by offering them cash or promising to cure them of long-term illnesses in Goa. "They're booked for promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion and for indulging in deliberate...malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings," police said.

286.title: China, Russia veto UN sanctions on N Korea over missile launches
286.article_body: China and Russia have vetoed a UN resolution sponsored by the US to impose more sanctions on North Korea over its renewed ballistic missile launches. The remaining 13 council members, including India, had voted in favour of the US-drafted resolution. After the vote on the resolution, Russia and China called for talks between North Korea and the US.

287.title: 7 Army soldiers killed, many hurt as vehicle falls into river in Ladakh: Reports
287.article_body: At least seven Army soldiers were killed in Ladakh's Turtuk village on Friday as the vehicle they were travelling in, skidded off the road and fell into the Shyok river, reports said. Many others have reportedly been grievously injured. The incident took place at around 9 am and there were 26 soldiers in the vehicle, reports added.

288.title: PM Modi flies B'luru-based startup's drone at Drone Mahotsav, video surfaces
288.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday flew a drone made by Bengaluru-based startup Asteria Aeronautics Limited at the Bharat Drone Mahotsav in Delhi. The drone PM Modi flew is meant for security and surveillance across different industry sectors. The Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022 is a two-day event with over 70 exhibitors displaying various use cases of drones.

289.title: Himachal approves 50% bus fare concession for women passengers
289.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh Cabinet has decided to provide 50% concession in fares to women passengers of Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) intra-state buses. The Cabinet will provide government guarantee in favour of HRTC for raising term loan of ₹160 crore to buy 360 buses and other vehicles. It'll also provide free domestic water supply to rural areas from May 1.

290.title: Asia's richest man's Adani Enterprises to buy 50% stake in General Aeronautics
290.article_body: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Enterprises on Friday announced that it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire 50% stake in General Aeronautics Private Limited. The Bengaluru-based company provides robotic drones and drone-based solutions for crop protection. The company didn't disclose the financial details of the deal. The deal is expected to close by July 31, 2022.

291.title: He's as much hero as his son: Akshay on father of martyred policeman
291.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has shared a video interview of the father of a policeman martyred in an encounter with militants in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla. Akshay tweeted, "This father is as much a hero as his son. Salute and respect." The policeman's father said that his son sacrificed his life for the nation and he is proud he was martyred.

292.title: Miller's showing what he can do, earlier he got no chances: Tewatia
292.article_body: GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said the team's batter David Miller is showing what he can do after being given a platform. "Earlier, there were no chances given to him," added Tewatia. Miller has scored 449 runs in IPL 2022 so far. Tewatia stated he loves being under pressure as it brings the best out of him.

293.title: Iran summons Swiss envoy over US' seizure of Iranian oil: Report
293.article_body: Iranian Foreign Ministry on Friday summoned Switzerland's envoy, who represents US' interests in Iran, to protest against the American seizure of Iranian oil from a Russian-operated ship near Greece, according to a local report. The ministry has called for the immediate release of the ship and its cargo, the report said. Iran has accused the US of breaking international laws.

294.title: B'wood filmmakers thought I wasn't 'saleable' face: Pratik Gandhi
294.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi has revealed that Hindi producers and directors thought he was a good actor but not "a saleable face in Bollywood". He further said that he was only approached for supporting characters, adding filmmakers were hesitant to cast him in lead roles. "When I look at the projects lined up, I don't feel nervous or pressurised," Pratik added.

295.title: BTS to meet US President Biden to discuss anti-Asian hate crimes
295.article_body: K-Pop band BTS have been invited to White House to celebrate the Asian American, Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islanders (AANHPI) Heritage Month. The band will also meet US President Joe Biden to discuss the importance of diversity, inclusion and anti-Asian hate crimes. Earlier, BTS collaborated with UNICEF for 'Love Myself' campaign, which is an anti-violence campaign.

296.title: Samson has thrown wicket away too often against spinners, pacers: Harbhajan
296.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said Sanju Samson threw his wicket away "too often" against both spinners and pacers in IPL 2022. "Samson has a lot of potential but...hasn't scored as many runs. He's made good 20s and 30s but...then got out due to...carelessness," added Harbhajan. "Had he scored 70s instead of 30s, he might have been in the Indian squad," stated Harbhajan.

297.title: Ex-minister kills himself after being accused of molesting granddaughter in U'khand
297.article_body: After his daughter-in-law filed a case accusing him of molesting his granddaughter, former Uttarakhand minister Rajendra Bahuguna climbed a water tank and shot himself dead on Wednesday. Bahuguna, 59, reportedly called the police from his home in Haldwani and told them about his plan. He killed himself after the police arrived.

298.title: Why shame Arunachal: Mahua on IAS officer's transfer over Delhi stadium row
298.article_body: Commenting on IAS officer couple Sanjeev Khirwar and Rinku Dugga's transfer to Ladakh and Arunachal Pradesh respectively, TMC's Mahua Moitra tweeted, "Why shame Arunachal by transferring errant Delhi bureaucrat?" Mahua asked Home Ministry, "Why pay lip service...treat Northeast like a dump for your rubbish?" The couple was accused of using a Delhi government-run stadium for walking their dog.

299.title: Former champion Halep loses to 19-year-old Zheng at French Open
299.article_body: Former champion Simona Halep lost to 19-year-old Qinwen Zheng 6-2, 2-6, 1-6  in second round of women's singles at French Open on Thursday. Meanwhile, world number one Iga Swiatek beat American Alison Riske 6-0, 6-2 for her 30th consecutive win. In men's singles, second-seeded Daniil Medvedev entered the third round following a 6-3, 6-4, 6-3 win against Serbian Laslo Djere.

300.title: China's FAW Group considers buying stake in DiDi Global: Report
300.article_body: Chinese automaker FAW Group is considering acquiring a significant stake in DiDi Global, Bloomberg reported. The state-owned firm has reached out to DiDi's top executives regarding its interest in becoming a major shareholder in it. Earlier, DiDi's shareholders had given their approval to the firm to delist from the US following a crackdown by Chinese regulators.

301.title: Disturbed by MLAs' photo sessions, Speaker bans selfies in UP Assembly
301.article_body: Disturbed by continuous photo sessions of MLAs, Uttar Pradesh Assembly Speaker Satish Mahana on Friday announced a ban on taking selfies inside the Assembly premises. The mobile phones of MLAs will be confiscated if found taking selfies and carrying out photo sessions, he said. The use of personal cameras in Assembly and gallery area during proceedings has also been banned.

302.title: Kapiva releases user stories of losing over 10 kgs with Get Slim Juice
302.article_body: In videos shared by Kapiva, Akanksha S shared how Get Slim Juice helped her lose 13 kgs in 6 months, while Tritoy M claimed to lose 24 kgs gained after spondylitis. Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda has reported that the juice with 12 herbs was deemed effective by 90% of users for boosting metabolism and reducing appetite for sustainable weight loss.

303.title: 2-month-old girl undergoes rare cataract surgery at Noida's PGICH
303.article_body: Doctors at Noida's Postgraduate Institute of Child Health successfully operated upon a two-month-old girl who was born with a cataract in her both eyes. While the cataract is fully removed from the left eye, the surgery on the right eye is due. Doctors said the small size of the girl's eye was the biggest challenge, making it a rare procedure.

304.title: More than firecrackers biomass burning worsens Delhi's air: Study
304.article_body: IIT Delhi researchers-led study has found that "biomass burning emissions rather than fireworks drive poor air quality in Delhi during the days following Diwali". Researchers found that metal content in PM2.5 levels rose by 1,100% during Diwali and that fireworks alone accounted for 95% of the metal. The study added that the impact of fireworks plummeted in around 12 hours.

305.title: Tuition teacher rapes, impregnates 17-yr-old student in Guj; arrested
305.article_body: A tuition teacher, Nainesh Damor, has been arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating a 17-year-old student in Gujarat's Dahod. The girl alleged that the accused filmed her while using the washroom at coaching centre in February and threatened to circulate the video if she didn't develop physical relations with him. He raped her multiple times after this, she claimed.

306.title: Japan to restart idled nuclear power plants: PM Kishida
306.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said that "with priority in safety", the country will take concrete steps to restart idled nuclear power plants to make maximum use of nuclear power to stabilise energy prices and supply. The government isn't considering replacing existing nuclear power plants with new ones, Kishida added. Dozens of Japan's reactors were idled after the Fukushima nuclear disaster.

307.title: Meta updates its Privacy Policy, allows Indian users to choose not to accept
307.article_body: Meta has announced that it has rewritten its Privacy Policy to make it easier to understand and is also updating its Terms of Service. The new policy covers Facebook, Instagram, Messenger and other Meta products. Users in India will have the option to accept these changes or not, without any impact on how they access their products, Meta said.

308.title: Google in talks to join India's open e-commerce network ONDC: Report
308.article_body: Google is in talks with the central government to integrate its shopping services with the country’s Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC), as per a report by Reuters. Modelled around the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) project, ONDC will allow buyers and sellers of e-commerce goods like grocery, food delivery and others, to transact regardless of the platform they are registered.

309.title: Uttarakhand to implement Uniform Civil Code: CM Pushkar Singh Dhami
309.article_body: Uttarakhand government has taken the decision to implement the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the state, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Friday. "Uttarakhand will be the second state after Goa to implement UCC," he added. "We will bring UCC for the people irrespective of them being from any religion and section of the society," Dhami further said.

310.title: I got a divorce, therapy: Jennifer on dealing with 'Friends' end
310.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston has joked that she dealt with her television show 'Friends' ending after 10 seasons by getting a divorce and going to therapy. The actress further said that she also did 'The Break-Up' and "kind of leaned into the end". Jennifer divorced actor Brad Pitt in 2005 after being married for five years and together for seven years.

311.title: India was and is an important stakeholder in Afghanistan: NSA Doval
311.article_body: Taking part in the 4th Regional Security Dialogue on Afghanistan, National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval said that India was and is an important stakeholder in Afghanistan. "Special relationship with people of Afghanistan over centuries will guide India's approach, nothing can change this," Doval added. Doval also told his counterparts that the people of Afghanistan have a special place.

312.title: Mother, 2 daughters kill selves after police raid their home in UP
312.article_body: Six persons, including a sub-inspector, were booked after a woman and her two daughters died by suicide after police raided their house in a village in Uttar Pradesh. Police were looking for the woman's 22-year-old son, who had eloped with a Dalit woman and was accused of kidnapping her. The woman's husband claimed police abused and misbehaved with the deceased.

313.title: No one will remember Pant if he only plays white-ball cricket: Sehwag
313.article_body: Former India batter Virender Sehwag has said that no one would remember much about wicket-keeper Rishabh Pant if he only plays in white-ball cricket. "Test cricket is the ultimate cricket," Sehwag said. "Why does Virat Kohli emphasise so much on playing Tests? He knows that if he plays 100-150 Tests, he will be immortalised in the record books," he added.

314.title: ED summons ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah in money laundering case
314.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned the National Conference president and former Jammu and Kashmir CM, Farooq Abdullah, in connection with a money laundering case in Delhi on May 31. The case pertains to alleged financial irregularities in the Jammu and Kashmir Cricket Association (JKCA). ED in 2020 had attached Abdullah's assets worth ₹11.86 crore in the case.

315.title: PMC appoints NEERI as consultant to upgrade Vaikunth crematorium
315.article_body: National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) has been appointed as a consultant by Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to upgrade Vaikunth Smashan Bhoomi in a bid to reduce air pollution. NEERI will be paid ₹15 lakh for the consultation, the civic body said. Earlier, NEERI had conducted a study to assess the extent of air pollution caused by the crematorium.

316.title: Why did NCB give clean chit to Aryan Khan in cruise drugs case?
316.article_body: According to an NCB official, Aryan Khan was given clean chit in cruise drugs case as no physical evidence was found against him. Confession statement taken by first team had discrepancy and chargesheet can't be filed just on WhatsApp chats, the official said. He added they followed the principle of proof beyond reasonable doubt to come to the conclusion.

317.title: Woman molested in Meta VR as another user watched, passed vodka around: Report
317.article_body: A 21-year-old female researcher's avatar was allegedly sexually assaulted by a male avatar in Meta's Virtual Reality (VR) platform Horizon Worlds, a report has said. Footage of the alleged assault reportedly showed another user watching it and passing a bottle of vodka around. The two male avatars are also seen making lewd comments in the footage, reports said.

318.title: Meghan Markle visits Texas to pay respect to mass shooting victims
318.article_body: Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle visited the memorial in Texas' Uvalde to pay respect to those who were killed in the elementary school mass shooting. As per her spokesperson, Meghan made the visit in a personal capacity as a mother to offer condolences and support in person. A gunman killed 21 people including 19 children at the school on Wednesday.

319.title: Israeli series 'Fauda' director Rotem Shamir to helm Indian film 'Garud'
319.article_body: Filmmaker Rotem Shamir, who directed Israeli thriller series 'Fauda', has been roped in to helm the Indian film 'Garud', which is based on the Afghan rescue crisis. The forthcoming project will be produced by Ajay Kapoor and Subhash Kale. Speaking about his collaboration with Rotem, Ajay said, "[He]...has a great experience in the sensibilities that we're looking at for Garud."

320.title: Priyanka, Arjun Kapoor pay tribute to 'Goodfellas' star Ray Liotta
320.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, Ranveer Singh and Arjun Kapoor paid tribute to 'Goodfellas' actor Ray Liotta, who passed away aged 67. Priyanka shared Liotta's picture on Instagram with a broken heart emoji. "Rest in peace goodfella," wrote Arjun Kapoor on his Instagram Story. Actor Ranveer Singh also shared a picture of the late actor on his Instagram Story with caption, "1954-2022. #RayLiotta."

321.title: Pune city reported more than 30 murders from Jan to April: Data
321.article_body: Pune city reported more than 30 murders in four months, i.e. from January to April, according to data provided by the Crime Branch of Pune Police. Reportedly, 14 murders took place due to 'flimsy reasons'. Notably, in a recent case, a 30-year-old pedestrian in Pune was allegedly stoned to death by two motorcycle-borne youths in a road rage incident.

322.title: We need more heavy weapons to fight Russia: Ukraine Foreign Min
322.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said the country needs more heavy weapons to fight Russia. "The only position where Russia is better than us, it's the amount of heavy weapons they have. Without artillery...multiple launch rocket systems we won't be able to push them back," he said. Kuleba added that the situation in the east of the country is "dire".

323.title: 7 deaths in past 15 days in Sirsa due to drug overdose: Hooda
323.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda has alleged that seven deaths have taken place in the past 15 days in Sirsa district due to drug "overdose". "In Sirsa, during the last 8 years, more than 1.25 lakh people have visited the civil hospital for de-addiction. This is only the figure that has come to the fore," Hooda said.

324.title: SUV carrying 30 liquor bottles runs over ASI in Bihar, owner booked
324.article_body: A Bihar Police Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) was run over by an SUV carrying 30 liquor bottles in Siwan district when he tried to intercept it to prevent smuggling of liquor. Another policeman was injured in the accident, police said, adding that the vehicle's owner has been booked. The SUV dragged the ASI for about 50 metres before overturning, officers said.

325.title: Maker of US school shooter's rifle posted image of kid with rifle on lap
325.article_body: Daniel Defense, the manufacturer of the rifle used in the mass school shooting in Texas on Tuesday, had used a toddler to advertise a similar weapon just eight days before the incident. The company has been criticised after screenshots of the advertisement circulated on social media. The 18-year-old shooter killed 21 people including 19 kids.

326.title: It's like ragging in colleges: Kamal Haasan on north-south cinema debate
326.article_body: Speaking on the controversy around north-south cinema, Kamal Haasan said, "It is topical, temporary, and it will pass." "It's like ragging in colleges. They then become very great friends and miss each other, they later come and hug each other with tears..it's a lack of understanding about what a diverse country India is," Haasan added.

327.title: Woman succumbs to burn injuries in suspected dowry death case in UP
327.article_body: A woman succumbed to her burn injuries a day after allegedly being set ablaze by her in-laws in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit. The accused demanded ₹2 lakh from the woman's family as a dowry which the latter was unable to fulfil, the deceased's family members alleged. Notably, the deceased got married in 2021 to a person in the district's Saijna village.

328.title: Will give away most of my wealth; kids to get the family house: Moderna CEO
328.article_body: Moderna CEO Stéphane Bancel told Bloomberg in an interview that he plans to donate the bulk of his family wealth. The 49-year-old billionaire said, "[My kids] will get the family house, you know. But the rest we're going to give away." Bancel holds a 1.36% stake in Moderna and has an estimated net worth of $4.1 billion, as per Bloomberg.

329.title: I feel Rakhi should wear less glamorous, more covered dresses: Boyfriend Adil
329.article_body: Rakhi Sawant's boyfriend and Bengaluru-based businessman Adil Khan Durrani said in an interview that he feels Rakhi should wear dresses which are "less glamorous and more covered". Rakhi, during the same interview, was asked if Adil is okay with her working in the entertainment industry, to which she replied, "He has never told me that I should quit my work."

330.title: Govt hikes third-party motor insurance premium after 2 yrs; effective from Jun 1
330.article_body: The Centre has hiked the third-party motor insurance premium for various categories of vehicles from June 1 after a gap of two years. Among the revised rates, for private cars with a 1,000 cc engine, the premium has been hiked to ₹2,094 from ₹2,072 and for two-wheelers with 150 cc-350 cc engine capacity, the premium has been increased to ₹1,366.

331.title: Manushi has a very sharp memory, she memorises everyone's dialogues: Akshay
331.article_body: Akshay Kumar, while talking about his 'Prithviraj' co-star Manushi Chhillar, said that she has a very sharp memory. "She used to memorise all dialogues, hers, mine as well as other actors. She could remember the toughest of words," added Akshay. 'Prithviraj' marks the Bollywood debut of Manushi, who'll be seen portraying Princess Sanyogita in the upcoming film.

332.title: Sangram Singh, Payal Rohatgi to have destination wedding on July 9
332.article_body: Wrestler Sangram Singh has stated that he will get married to actress Payal Rohatgi in a destination wedding on July 9. Sangram added that they are currently finalising a venue for the "low-key affair" in Ahmedabad or Udaipur. The couple is also planning to host a reception for their friends in Mumbai. Sangram and Payal have been together since 2011.

333.title: Human genome of Pompeii victim found in 1930s sequenced for 1st time
333.article_body: The genome of a Pompeii man who died after Mount Vesuvius' eruption in 79 AD has been successfully sequenced for the first time. The scientists extracted DNA from two victims, a man and a woman, whose remains were found in the 1930s. The man was aged between 35-40 and DNA sequences suggested he may have had tuberculosis before his death.

334.title: Robbers throw chilli powder in Gurugram petrol pump staffer's eyes
334.article_body: Six men were arrested for trying to rob a Gurugram petrol pump employee  by throwing chilli powder in his eyes, police said. The staffer was going to a bank to deposit cash worth ₹16.08 lakh he had collected. He said the accused, who tried to snatch his bag, escaped after he raised an alarm and ran towards the bank.

335.title: 19-yr-old girl falls from 5th floor of her house in Delhi, dies
335.article_body: A 19-year-old girl died after falling from her house's fifth floor in Delhi on Tuesday, police said. A small diary has reportedly been recovered from the deceased's possession wherein she has asked one of her family members to take care of themselves. Her family has said that she was struggling with obesity, which was a cause of concern for her.

336.title: Warning added to Stranger Things 4 premiere after Texas school shooting
336.article_body: Netflix has added a warning note to 'Stranger Things 4' premiere following the Texas school shooting incident. "We filmed this season of 'Stranger Things' a year ago. But given the recent tragic shooting at a school in Texas, viewers may find...opening scene of episode 1 distressing," the note read. Notably, 19 children and two adults were killed in the incident.

337.title: Indian cricket's man for all seasons: Jaffer to Shastri on 60th birthday
337.article_body: Taking to Twitter to wish Ravi Shastri on his 60th birthday on Friday, Wasim Jaffer wrote, "Happy birthday to Indian cricket's man for all seasons." He added, "Pick any iconic moment in Indian cricket in last few decades and you'll find Shastri there. On the field, in...commentary box or in...dressing room." Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Keep rocking the way you do."

338.title: 25-yr-old Dalit man killed over inter-faith relationship in K'taka, 2 held
338.article_body: A 25-year-old Dalit man, identified as Vijaya Kamble, was allegedly murdered over a relationship with a girl from another religion in Karnataka's Kalaburagi, police said. The girl's brother and his associate were arrested in connection with the murder, police added. The brother had threatened to cut off Vijaya's head if he didn't break off the relationship, the victim's mother alleged.

339.title: 'Woh badmash hai': Manoj Tiwari on Owaisi's remark on Gyanvapi case
339.article_body: Reacting to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's remark that Muslims won't give up the Gyanvapi Mosque, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari said, "Woh (Owaisi) badmash hai (He is a troublemaker)." "Only want to say this that where the proof is in front of us, no one has to fight. Let's have faith in the judiciary, we will accept court's verdict," Tiwari added.

340.title: Colombia police kill drug trafficker who escaped jail dressed as prison guard
340.article_body: One of Colombia's most-wanted drug traffickers, Juan Larinson Castro, was killed in a police operation on Thursday, the government said. The 41-year-old had escaped from a maximum-security jail in the capital, Bogotá, in March this year while dressed as a prison guard. Castro was accused of being allied with Mexican cartels and of shipping tonnes of cocaine to the US.

341.title: Ex-Haryana CM Chautala gets 4-yr jail, fined ₹50 lakh over disproportionate assets
341.article_body: A special CBI Court in Delhi on Friday sentenced former Haryana CM OP Chautala to four years imprisonment in a disproportionate assets case. The court also imposed a ₹50 lakh fine on Chautala and ordered the confiscation of four of his properties. The 87-year-old was convicted by the court last week.

342.title: People want to put my baby in microwave: Amber on threats after Depp's defamation lawsuit
342.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has spoken about the threats she has experienced after she countered Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit with her own counterclaims. "People want to kill me and they tell me so every day...People want to put my baby in the microwave," she stated. "I would not wish this situation on my worst enemy," Amber told the jury.

343.title: Policemen suffocate black man to death in smoke-filled trunk of car in Brazil
343.article_body: Brazilians have responded with outrage after a video showing a black man being suffocated to death by policemen in smoke-filled trunk of their car surfaced on social media. Genivaldo de Jesus Santos, 38, was stopped by the federal highway police in the city of Umbaúba on Wednesday. The man can be heard screaming in the video.

344.title: Teen girl dies after coming under wheels of school bus in B'luru
344.article_body: A 16-year-old girl died after coming under the wheels of a school bus belonging to Delhi Public School in Bengaluru on Thursday. The girl was triple riding on a bike with two others when the bus knocked them down. She was killed instantly, while the two others sustained injuries. The bus driver abandoned the vehicle and fled from the spot.

345.title: Researchers discover lost city with cosmic link in the Amazon
345.article_body: The ruins of a vast ancient civilization that thrived from 500 to 1400 AD have been discovered in the Bolivian Amazon. The settlements that stretched across some 207 square kilometres included pyramids, causeways, canals, ramparts, elevated "forest islands" and buildings arranged in ways that hint at cosmological worldview. As per the study, the structures were built by the Casarabe culture.

346.title: 14-year-old boy detained for sodomising 4-year-old boy in Greater Noida
346.article_body: A 14-year-old boy has been detained for allegedly sodomising a four-year-old neighbour in Greater Noida's Surajpur area, police said. "We received information on Wednesday...and found the four-year-old boy was bleeding," police added. "The accused locked the door and forced himself on the four-year-old. As he screamed, the family members of both the boys rushed to the room," police stated.

347.title: Adani Wilmar best-performing Asia IPO among firms that raised over $100 mn in 2022
347.article_body: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Wilmar is the best-performing stock among 121 Asian companies that listed on the stock exchanges after raising over $100 million this year. Shares of Adani Wilmar have almost tripled since their market debut. Notably, almost two-thirds of Asia's new stock listings are trading in the red amid rising interest rates and the Russia-Ukraine war.

348.title: Kohli, Dhoni are made of different mettle; maybe Rahul isn't: Manjrekar
