348.article_body: Sanjay Manjrekar said Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni love the responsibility of being the captains and key players of their sides. "Rohit Sharma...generally likes that...responsibility," added Manjrekar. Discussing KL Rahul's 79 in IPL 2022's Eliminator, Manjrekar stated Rahul is temperamentally "not" suited to take such responsibility. "They are...made of different mettle...maybe Rahul isn't," he said.

349.title: 76 critical spots prone to flooding identified in Pune, 59 cleared
349.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has identified 76 critical spots that are prone to flooding or waterlogging, officials said, adding that 59 of these were cleared till May 23. The deadline for pre-monsoon cleaning work is May 31 and officials said work will be completed "well before monsoon arrives". PMC also identified 373 culverts, of which 305 have been cleared.

350.title: Revenue from sale of liquor dipped in GB Nagar: Officials
350.article_body: Revenue from sale of liquor has dipped across GB Nagar in past few months, the excise department officials said, attributing the fall to neighbouring Delhi's heavy discounts on liquor. "We are struggling to even meet the set targets," the officials added. The department, which was given the target of ₹137 crore for May, collected only ₹85 crore till May 25.

351.title: US-based Joby Aviation gets 1st FAA approval for commercial air taxi service
351.article_body: US-based electric aviation company Joby Aviation has said that it has received its first certification from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) that allows it to begin its air taxi operations commercially with an aircraft. However, Joby Aviation still needs two more certifications before it can legally fly passengers. The company has aimed to launch its air taxi service by 2024.

352.title: Gay roles 'sanitised' as actors aren't comfortable: Filmmaker Onir
352.article_body: Filmmaker Onir, while talking about non-queer actors playing queer roles, said he has noticed male actors getting awkward while filming intimate scenes with other men. He stated that it's this inhibition of actors that gay roles have to be 'sanitised' on screen. "They've no qualms about playing a rapist but playing...gay man onscreen is an issue for many," Onir added.

353.title: Was one of the top models: Anupamaa's Sudhanshu shares pic from modelling days
353.article_body: Sudhanshu Pandey, who plays Vanraj Shah on show 'Anupamaa', took to Instagram to share a throwback picture from his modelling days. "This photo is [from]...when I was barely 20-21 and was already one of the top models in the country," the 47-year-old actor wrote. Reacting to his post, actor Taher Shabbir wrote, "Only that you look the same even now."

354.title: Excited to play final in Ahmedabad, familiar with pitch: Yash Dayal
354.article_body: Gujarat Titans pacer Yash Dayal has said that their franchise is "excited to play the final" at their home ground, Narendra Modi Stadium, in Ahmedabad. "Our entire focus is on playing well in the final. We are familiar with the pitch and ground of Ahmedabad as our camp was earlier located," the 24-year-old IPL debutant said.

355.title: Don't expect Russia to terminate space station cooperation: ESA
355.article_body: ESA Director-General Josef Aschbacher has said he doesn't expect Russia to terminate the joint operation of the International Space Station (ISS) with the West for the foreseeable future. "It is not possible...to separate the two units [Russian and Western parts] because they are linked together," Aschbacher added. "We do need Russia, and Russia needs the Western part," he further said.

356.title: Pune village imposes ban on widow customs after govt order
356.article_body: After the Maharashtra government's directive, Pune's Udachiwadi village has implemented a ban on funerary customs linked to widows such as wiping off the vermilion and breaking their bangles. After the passing of the resolution at the gram sabha, vermilion was applied to the foreheads of a few widows. Previously, Kolhapur's Hervad and Mangaon villages had also passed the resolution.

357.title: DU college principal booked 2 yrs after ad hoc prof alleged caste bias
357.article_body: FIR was lodged against Delhi University's Daulat Ram College Principal Savita Roy and Registrar Vikas Gupta, two years after an ad hoc assistant professor alleged caste bias. "I didn't fit into her stereotype of what a Dalit woman should be like," complainant said. She had accused Roy of firing her without notice and discriminating against her on basis of caste.

358.title: Injured S Korean volunteer fighter in Ukraine returns home, faces probe
358.article_body: An ex-South Korean naval special forces soldier returned home on Friday after fighting for Ukraine as a volunteer fighter to recover from injuries. Upon arrival, Rhee Keun said he was ready to face a police investigation over suspicion of defying South Korea's government's ban on travel to Ukraine. Keun added that he wants to go to Ukraine "because...war hasn't ended".

359.title: CBI seized my confidential documents during raid: Karti Chidambaram
359.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has alleged that the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) seized his sensitive documents during the raid on him in connection with the Chinese visa scam case. "The CBI seized my highly confidential and sensitive personal notes and papers pertaining to Parliamentary Standing Committee for Information and Technology, of which I am a Member," Chidambaram said.

360.title: Most dinosaurs were warm-blooded: Research
360.article_body: After analysing the bones of dinosaurs that indicated how much the individual animals breathed in last hour of their life, researchers have concluded that most dinosaurs were warm-blooded. According to research, the lizard-hipped dinosaurs had low metabolic rates as compared to the cold-blooded modern animals. Moreover, the bird-hipped dinosaurs were warm or even hot-blooded, the study has found.

361.title: Taj Mahal is mine, Madurai temple is yours: Haasan on B'wood vs south debate
361.article_body: Kamal Haasan, during the promotion of his film 'Vikram: Hitlist', said he doesn't understand the north vs south cinema debate, adding, "I'm an Indian, what are you?" "For me, the Taj Mahal is mine and...Madurai temple is yours. Kanniyakumari is as much yours as Kashmir is mine," he added. 'Vikram: Hitlist' will release in Hindi, Kannada, Telugu, Malayalam and Tamil.

362.title: I conduct surprise inspection of govt work with help of drones: PM Modi
362.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking at the two-day Bharat Drone Mahotsav, spoke about how he uses drones for surprise inspections. He said, "If I want to check the quality of government work, I don’t...inform in advance. Because then everything will be in place. If I send a drone, the requisite information is collected and officials don't even get to know."

363.title: Babar is 100% capable of becoming first no.1 batter across formats: Karthik
363.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said Pakistan captain Babar Azam is "hundred percent" capable of becoming the first player to be ranked as the number one batter across formats. "[Babar] is a high-quality player who is at the peak of his batting prowess," added Karthik. "[He's] been phenomenal in all...formats...and...has done well in different batting positions," stated Karthik.

364.title: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan given clean chit by NCB in cruise drugs case
364.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan has been given clean chit by Narcotics Control Bureau in the cruise drugs case. "All the accused persons were found in possession of narcotics except Aryan and Mohak," a statement by Sanjay Kumar Singh, DDG (Operations), NCB, read. "A complaint against 14 persons under various sections of the NDPS Act is being filed," Singh said.

365.title: Eastern Railway achieves 100% electrification of 2,848 km-network
365.article_body: Eastern Railway achieved 100% electrification of its entire 2,848 kilometre-long network, an official said on Friday. This comes after completion of electrification work in the 41 kilometre-long Hansdiha-Godda section in Jharkhand. The speed trial was conducted by the Commissioner of Railway Safety at 103 km per hour, Kolkata-headquartered zonal railway's spokesperson Ekalabya Chakraborty said.

366.title: Economic recovery is underway in spite of headwinds: RBI in its annual report
366.article_body: In its annual report released on Friday, the RBI while referring to the Indian economy said that "a recovery is underway in spite of headwinds". Highlighting "structural reforms", RBI said that the future path of growth will be conditioned by addressing "supply-side bottlenecks and calibrating monetary and fiscal policy support to aggregate demand and structural reforms".

367.title: Ronaldo will be a massive problem for Man Utd next season: Carragher
367.article_body: Ex-Liverpool player Jamie Carragher said Cristiano Ronaldo will be a "massive problem" for Manchester United next season if he does not get a chance to play every week. "We've seen it this season. Even when he's coming off...he's kicked up a fuss," added Carragher. Carragher stated he has consistently said throughout this season that Ronaldo was "not" a good signing.

368.title: Drones' usage will rise in agriculture, defence, sports: PM Modi
368.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi after inaugurating the drone festival in Delhi said, "Use of drones will rise in sectors such as agriculture, sports, defence and disaster management." He added that India has the potential of becoming a global drone hub. "There was an environment of 'indifference' towards the use of technology in governance before 2014," he added.

369.title: Mumbai YouTuber arrested for committing thefts to fund lavish lifestyle
369.article_body: A 30-year-old YouTuber, Abhimanyu Gupta, was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly committing house break-ins to fund his lavish lifestyle. Police have seized 14 mobile phones, sharp weapons, fake jewellery and foreign currency from him. Apart from valuables, he'd also steal shoes and slippers kept outside house and wore cap and face mask to conceal his identity during thefts, police said.

370.title: Indian Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa loses to world no. 2 in Chessable Masters final
370.article_body: Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa lost to world no. 2 Ding Liren in the tie-break of the Meltwater Champions Chess Tour Chessable Masters 2022 online tournament final. The 16-year-old from Chennai fought back to win the second set after having lost the opener. Praggnanandhaa had defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the fifth round of the tournament.

371.title: Musk calls recession 'good thing', says, 'Money raining on fools for too long'
371.article_body: Responding to a follower who asked him if recession was approaching, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Yes, but this is actually a good thing." He added, "It has been raining money on fools for too long. Some bankruptcies need to happen." In another tweet, he also said that the recession may last for "about 12 to 18 months".

372.title: Man arrested for raping, attempting to kill 5-yr-old daughter in Pune
372.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his five-year-old daughter and then attempting to kill her, Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police said. The man allegedly went to his daughter and she resisted, police added. He had an argument with his wife when she intervened and the accused allegedly threw their daughter on the floor and tried to strangle her, police stated.

373.title: Drone industry to reach ₹15,000 cr turnover by 2026: Scindia
373.article_body: Addressing the 'Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022' event, Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "It is estimated that the drone industry will reach ₹15,000 crore turnover by the year 2026." Currently, there are 270 drone startups in India, Scindia said during the event. 'Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022' is a two-day event (May 27-28) being held in Delhi's Pragati Maidan.

374.title: Annual 'fish prasadam' distribution in Hyd scrapped for 3rd consecutive yr
374.article_body: The annual 'fish prasadam' distribution in Hyderabad has been cancelled for a third consecutive year. The Bathini Goud family has decided not to organise the event as precautionary measure amid COVID-19. Notably, the 'prasadam', which consists of a live murrel fish with a yellow herbal paste, is touted to provide relief to asthma patients if taken for three consecutive years.

375.title: Delhi riots accused who pointed gun at police welcomed by huge crowd during parole
375.article_body: Delhi riots accused Shahrukh Pathan, who had pointed a gun at a policeman, recently arrived at his family residence on a four-hour parole. Pathan was welcomed by a huge crowd on his arrival, a video on social media showed. In a video dated May 23, people can be heard cheering and whistling as they flock around Pathan.

376.title: Tesla submits application to expand German plant by 100 hectares
376.article_body: Tesla has submitted an application to expand its German plant by another 100 hectares, expanding its area by a third, Gruenheide Mayor Arne Christiani was quoted as saying. The firm plans to build a freight station, logistics areas and parking spaces on the additional space. The proposal will be discussed at a municipality meeting on June 2.

377.title: 3-year-old run over by reversing water tanker in Bengaluru
377.article_body: A three-year-old girl Pratiksha Bhat was run over by a water tanker outside her house at Serenity Layout near Bengaluru's Sarjapur Road area. The incident took place around 12.10 pm on Thursday when the tanker driver, after unloading water at a nearby apartment, was trying to reverse the vehicle. He did not notice Pratiksha playing and knocked her down.

378.title: China is greater long-term threat than Russia: US State Secy
378.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said Russia & President Vladimir Putin "pose a present threat", but America sees China as a long-term threat to global stability. "China is the only country" that has both the intent and the might to reshape the international order, he added. Blinken further said the US isn't looking for "conflict or...new Cold War" with China.

379.title: Ex-Twitter official accuses Dorsey of 'backstabbing' Twitter board by helping Musk
379.article_body: An ex-Twitter board member has accused former CEO Jack Dorsey of "backstabbing" his company’s board by helping Tesla CEO Elon Musk acquire it. Jason Goldman said that after it was agreed to bring Musk on as a director, Dorsey "shared his personal view that Twitter would be able to better focus on execution as a private company".

380.title: Model found dead at her home 2 days after model friend was found hanging in Kolkata
380.article_body: A model has been found dead at her residence in Kolkata's Patuli area, the second such incident in three days, the police said. Manjusha Neogi's mother claimed that her daughter was suffering from "acute depression" after the death of her friend and colleague in the industry, Bidisha De Majumder. Bidisha was found hanging at her rented flat on Wednesday.

381.title: GB Nagar's govt schools get loudspeakers taken down from religious sites
381.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police has facilitated the donation of the loudspeakers, which were taken down from religious places, to various government schools in the district. Over 10 loudspeakers were willingly donated by the representatives of various temples and mosques, police said. However, the schools have been asked to not exceed the prescribed decibel levels while using the loudspeakers.

382.title: We were scared of receiving backlash: Deepak on 'Roadies' spoof
382.article_body: 'Panchayat' director Deepak Kumar Mishra, who played Raghu Ram in Roadies' spoof titled 'Rowdies', spoke about the show and said, "We were...careful to not go personal." "We were scared of receiving a backlash and we handled it with maturity," he added. Deepak further said that the team decided to spoof 'Roadies' because of its popularity.

383.title: 15 hurt as bus falls into gorge in Palghar, driver's negligence suspected
383.article_body: At least 15 people were injured after bus they were travelling in fell into a 25-foot-deep gorge on Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway in Palghar on Friday. One of the passengers alleged that the driver was inebriated and drove the bus rashly. The medical examination of the driver who is severely injured will be conducted later and action will be taken, police said.

384.title: Being benched was tough to deal with: MI's ₹8.25 crore buy Tim David
384.article_body: Talking about being benched by MI in IPL 2022 after being picked for ₹8.25 crore in the mega auction, all-rounder Tim David said, "It's tough to deal with...and...just a period of time you have to accept." "I worked really hard on my batting," added David. He had a strike rate of 216.27 in IPL 2022 having played eight matches.

385.title: Google hit with 2nd probe in UK over its ad practices
385.article_body: The UK CMA has launched its second investigation into Google's advertising practices saying it could be distorting competition. "We're worried that Google may be using its position...to favour its own services to the detriment of its rivals, of its customers and ultimately of consumers," the agency said. Earlier, the agency had probed Google and Meta's 'Jedi Blue' agreement.

386.title: Congress a 'torn-old party', has lost vision, relevance: BJP
386.article_body: BJP national spokesperson and Rajya Sabha MP Sudhanshu Trivedi on Thursday called Congress a "torn-old party" that has lost its "vision". "The Congress is progressively moving towards a stage where its relevance and necessity is completely lost," Trivedi said. His comments came after Congress released a booklet highlighting failures of BJP-led central government ahead of its eighth anniversary.

387.title: Free me from 'dishonourable' post, give it to your Principal Secy: Raj Min to CM
387.article_body: Rajasthan Sports Minister Ashok Chandna in a tweet requested CM Ashok Gehlot to free him from his "dishonourable" ministerial post and give the charge of all the departments under him to CM's Principal Secretary Kuldeep Ranka. "Anyway, he is the minister of all the departments," he added. Chandna holds Sports and Youth Affairs, Skill Development, Employment and other portfolios.

388.title: Old pic of 'Panchayat' actors Neena Gupta and Raghubir goes viral
388.article_body: An old picture of 'Panchayat' actors Neena Gupta and Raghubir Yadav, apparently from 1982, has gone viral on social media. In the picture, Neena and Raghubir are seen holding mics. Neena plays village sarpanch, Manju Devi, in 'Panchayat' while Raghubir Yadav plays her husband, Brij Bhushan Dubey. Directed by Deepak Kumar Mishra, 'Panchayat' also stars Jitendra Kumar.

389.title: Despite personal setbacks, Karthik came back well: Shoaib Akhtar
389.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar spoke on Indian batter Dinesh Karthik (36) making a comeback into India's T20I squad for the home series against South Africa. "I usually avoid speaking about people's personal lives. What I want to say here is that he (Karthik) had suffered some setbacks in his personal life, but he came back really well," Akhtar said.

390.title: Who were the highest paid female CEOs in the US in 2021?
390.article_body: Advanced Micro Devices' CEO Lisa T Su was the highest-paid female executive at $29.5 million in the US in 2021. She was followed by General Motors' CEO Mary T Barra at $29.1 million, General Dynamics' Phebe N Novakovic at $23.6 million, Nasdaq's Adena Friedman at $20 million and Northrop Grumman's Kathy J Warden at $19.5 million.

391.title: BJP will revive 36,000 temples destroyed by Mughals: KS Eshwarappa
391.article_body: BJP leader KS Eshwarappa said that his party will "revive" all the temples which were destroyed by Mughals. "Why was a temple shifted in Srirangapatna and a mosque built in its place? A total of 36,000 temples were destroyed by the Mughals. We will revive all of them," he said. Eshwarappa was recently sacked from Karnataka cabinet over corruption allegations.

392.title: Naxals set 6 construction vehicles on fire in Odisha
392.article_body: Naxalites set six vehicles engaged in road construction work afire at Tala Pipili village in Odisha's Kalahandi district on Wednesday night. Over 40 Naxals reached the spot and eventually torched the vehicles for low-quality construction work, police said. Locals claimed it was an act of revenge as one of their group members was arrested recently, though police claimed he surrendered.

393.title: We compare him to Rahul Dravid, call him Dravid: Azam on Abdullah Shafique
393.article_body: Talking about batter Abdullah Shafique, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said, "Usually, we compare him to Kane Williamson and Rahul Dravid. We call him Dravid." "I personally watch and definitely enjoy Abdullah's stylish batting. He plays very clean, his stance and the way he ducks the ball are impressive," added Azam. Dravid is currently the head coach of Team India.

394.title: PM Modi inaugurates India's biggest drone festival in Delhi
394.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated the Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022, India's biggest drone festival, at the Pragati Maidan in Delhi. Prime Minister Modi had urged all those interested in tech and innovation to watch the programme, saying, "This forum brings together key stakeholders including startups with the aim of increasing India's presence in the sector."

395.title: Who were the highest paid male CEOs in the US in 2021?
395.article_body: As per the data compiled by Associated Press and Equilar, Expedia CEO Peter Kern was the highest-paid male executive at $296.2 million in the US in 2021. He was followed by Warner Bros. Discovery CEO David Zaslav at $246.6 million, ServiceNow’s William McDermott at $165.8 million, Apple's Tim Cook at $98.7 million and JPMorgan Chase’s Jamie Dimon at $84.4 million.

396.title: Iraq passes bill criminalising relations with Israel
396.article_body: Iraqi Parliament has passed a law that makes it a crime to normalise ties with Israel and violations of the law can be punishable with a death sentence or life imprisonment. A total of 275 legislators in Iraq's 329-seat assembly voted in favour of it. This comes at a time when several Arab countries have established formal ties with Israel.

397.title: Islamic State's new chief captured in Istanbul: Reports
397.article_body: Islamic State's new leader Abu al-Hassan al-Qurayshi has been captured in a recent raid in Istanbul, according to reports quoting senior Turkish officials. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has been informed of his capture, the officials said on Thursday. Erdogan is expected to announce the arrest in the coming days, OdaTV said.

398.title: Death toll due to Assam floods, landslides rises to 30: ASDMA
398.article_body: The death toll due to floods and landslides in Assam has risen to 30, Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. This comes after two persons died due to drowning in floodwaters in Nagaon. Around 5.61 lakh people across 12 districts are still affected due to floods, ASDMA stated. Over 47,000 hectares of crop area has been damaged across Assam.

399.title: No political ties between Cong, JD(S) for RS, 2023 polls: Siddaramaiah
399.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has ruled out any alliance between the Congress and JD(S) for the upcoming Rajya Sabha polls and the next year's State Assembly elections. "We (Congress) will not have any political relationship with JD(S)," Siddaramaiah said. The elections for Karnataka's four Rajya Sabha seats will be held on June 10.

400.title: Madhya Pradesh Guv gives nod to ordinance on direct election of mayors
400.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Governor Mangubhai C Patel gave his nod to an ordinance proposing the direct election of mayors in municipal corporations. "People will directly elect Mayors...chairpersons and vice-chairpersons of municipal councils and nagar panchayats will be elected by corporators chosen by voters," a minister said. "Proposal will be sent to state EC for implementation," the minister stated.

401.title: Who do you trust less, politicians or billionaires: Musk asks in poll
401.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to take a poll on who the users "trust less", politicians or billionaires. Following his poll, Musk extended a challenge to US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, saying, "I dare you to run the same poll with your followers." Replying to his tweet, a user wrote, "I trust AOC more than I trust you, Elon."
